original: Theravāda Vinaya
analyzed: thera vāda vinaya
translated: The Pāṭimokkha of the Theravāda Vinaya

original: Mahāvibhaṅga🔽Pārājikakaṇḍa
analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  pārājika kaṇḍa
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The Chapter on the Pārājika Offenses

original: 1. Paṭhamapārājikasikkhāpada
analyzed: paṭhama pārājika sikkhāpada
translated: The first training rule on expulsion

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha.

original: Verañjakaṇḍa
analyzed: verañja kaṇḍa
translated: The chapter on Verañjā

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā verañjāyaṁ viharati naḷerupucimandamūle mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā verañjāyam viharati naḷeru pucimandamūle mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: At that time the Buddha, the Fortunate One, was dwelling near Verañjā, at the foot of Naḷeru’s Nimba tree, together with a great Saṅgha of five hundred monks.

original: Assosi kho verañjo brāhmaṇo—
analyzed: assosi kho verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: The brahmin Verañjā heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito verañjāyaṁ viharati naḷerupucimandamūle mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.🔽Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato—
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ verañjāyam viharati naḷeru pucimandamūle mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi  tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: “The ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan, who has gone forth from the Sakya family, is dwelling near Verañjā, at the foot of Naḷeru’s Nimba tree, together with a great Saṅgha of five hundred monks.🔽And this good report about that Fortunate One has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’,
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: ‘Thus indeed is he the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, the one endowed with understanding and good conduct, the Happy One, the one who understands the worlds, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Fortunate One.’

original: so imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti,
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has realized this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known.

original: so dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ; kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti;
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

original: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ
analyzed: atha khalu verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhi
translated: Then the brahmin Verañjā went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: sammodi. Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno
analyzed: sammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down to one side

original: kho verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: kho verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to the Buddha,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama—
analyzed: sutam mā ita bho gotama
translated: “Master Gotama, I have heard that

original: ‘na samaṇo gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimantetī’ti.
analyzed: na samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama doesn’t bow down to old and well-born brahmins, stand up for them, or offer them a seat.’

original: Tayidaṁ, bho gotama, tatheva? Na hi bhavaṁ gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti?
analyzed: bho gotama tathā iva na hi bhavam gotamaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti
translated: Is that so, Master Gotama? For Master Gotama does not rise up to greet aged brahmins, venerable and mature, who are senior by seniority, or offer them a seat.

original: Tayidaṁ, bho gotama, na sampannamevā”ti.
analyzed: bho gotama na sampannam eva ati
translated: That is not proper for Master Gotama.”

original: “Nāhaṁ taṁ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yamahaṁ abhivādeyyaṁ vā paccuṭṭheyyaṁ vā āsanena vā nimanteyyaṁ.
analyzed: na aham ta brāhmaṇa passāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya yam aham abhivādeyyam vā paccuṭṭheyyam vā āsanena vā nimanteyya
translated: “Brahmin, I do not see even a single person in the world with its gods, Maras, and Brahmas, in this generation with its royalty and brahmins, its householders and ascetics, its gods and humans, who could satisfy the mind with a reply to my questions.

original: Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, tathāgato abhivādeyya vā paccuṭṭheyya vā āsanena vā nimanteyya, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā”ti.
analyzed: yat hi brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ abhivādeyya vā paccuṭṭheyya vā āsanena vā nimanteyya muddhā api tassa vipateyya ati
translated: If I were to rise up to greet such a person, or offer him a seat, his head would split.”

original: “Arasarūpo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: a rasa rūpaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Master Gotama is without a peer.”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘arasarūpo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya arasa rūpaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one could rightly say of me that I am without a peer:

original: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, rūparasā saddarasā gandharasā rasarasā phoṭṭhabbarasā, te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: ye te brāhmaṇa rūpa rasā sadda rasāḥ gandha rasāḥ rasa rasā phoṭṭhabba rasā te tathāgatassa pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned, cut off at the root, made a skeleton, and obliterated the relish for forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects so that they are no more subject to future arising.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘arasarūpo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya arasa rūpaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is the method by which one speaking rightly would say that the recluse Gotama has no relish, and not as you have thought to say it.”

original: “Nibbhogo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: nibbhogaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Master Gotama is free from attachment?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘nibbhogo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a nibbhogaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a method, brahmin, by which one speaking rightly would say that the recluse Gotama is free from attachment.

original: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, rūpabhogā saddabhogā gandhabhogā rasabhogā phoṭṭhabbabhogā, te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: ye te brāhmaṇa rūpa bhogā sadda bhogā gandha bhogā rasa bhogā phoṭṭhabba bhogā te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned, cut off at the root, made a skeleton, and obliterated the attachment to forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects so that they are no more subject to future arising.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘nibbhogo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a nibbhogaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is the way in which a right-speaking person could say of me that I am one who teaches non-experience, and not in the way you have suggested.”

original: “Akiriyavādo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: a kiriya vādaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Is Master Gotama one who teaches non-action?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a kiriya vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which a right-speaking person could say of me that I am one who teaches non-action.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, akiriyaṁ vadāmi kāyaduccaritassa vacīduccaritassa manoduccaritassa.
analyzed: aham hi brāhmaṇa akiriyam vadāmi kāya duccaritassa vacī duccaritassa manaḥ duccaritassa
translated: I say that bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct should not be done.

original: Anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ akiriyaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam akiriyam vadāmi
translated: I say that many kinds of bad unwholesome qualities should not be done.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘akiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a kiriya vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is the way in which a right-speaking person could say of me that I am one who teaches non-action, and not in the way you have suggested.”

original: “Ucchedavādo bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: uccheda vādaḥ
translated: “Is Master Gotama one who teaches annihilation?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya auccheda vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking correctly could say that I am an annihilationist.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, ucchedaṁ vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa.
analyzed: ahan hi brāhmaṇaḥ ucchedam vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa
translated: I declare the annihilation of lust, hatred, and delusion.

original: Anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ ucchedaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam ucchedam vadāmi
translated: I declare the annihilation of numerous bad and unwholesome qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya auccheda vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is a way in which one speaking correctly could say that I am an annihilationist, but not in the sense that you mean.”

original: “Jegucchī bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: jegucchī bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Is Master Gotama disgusted?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a jegucchī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking correctly could say that I am disgusted.

original: Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, jigucchāmi kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena.
analyzed: ahan hi brāhmaṇa jigucchāmi kāya duccaritena vacī duccaritena manaḥ duccaritena
translated: I am disgusted with misconduct by body, speech, and mind,

original: Anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā jigucchāmi.
analyzed: aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā jigucchāmi
translated: and with the attainment of numerous bad and unwholesome qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘jegucchī samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a jegucchī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is the way in which a person might rightly say of me that I am disgusted, and yet you have not understood the meaning of what you have said.”

original: “Venayiko bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: venayikaḥ bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Is Master Gotama an instructor of gods and humans?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo’ti.🔽Ahañhi, brāhmaṇa, vinayāya dhammaṁ desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya venayikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti  aham hi brāhmaṇa vinayāya dhammam desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa
translated: “There is a way in which a person might rightly say of me that I am an instructor of gods and humans.🔽I teach the Dhamma for the fading away of lust, for the fading away of hatred, for the fading away of delusion.

original: Anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ vinayāya dhammaṁ desemi.
analyzed: aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam vinayāya dhammam desemi
translated: I teach the Dhamma for the abandoning of numerous bad and unwholesome qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘venayiko samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya venayikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is the way in which a person might rightly say of me that I am an instructor of gods and humans, and yet you have not understood the meaning of what you have said.”

original: “Tapassī bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: tapassī bhavam gotama uti
translated: “Is Master Gotama an ascetic?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a tapassī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a way in which a person might rightly say of me that I am an ascetic.

original: Tapanīyāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi, kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ.
analyzed: tapanīyā āha brāhmaṇa pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam manaḥ duccarita
translated: I say that evil unwholesome states are to be scorched by heat.

original: Yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā tamahaṁ tapassīti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kho brāhmaṇa tapanīyā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā tam aham tapassi iti vadāmi
translated: One in whom such evil unwholesome states are abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that they are no more subject to future arising—him I call one who scorches by heat.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, brāhmaṇa, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho brāhmaṇa tapanīyā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that they are no more subject to future arising.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘tapassī samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya a tapassī samaṇaḥ gotama iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti
translated: This is the way in which one speaking rightly of me would speak. But you, brahmin, are not speaking rightly of me.”

original: “Apagabbho bhavaṁ gotamo”ti?
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ bhavam gotama iti
translated: “Master Gotama is free from the rod?”

original: “Atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: atthi khvā esa brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti
translated: “There is a way, brahmin, in which one speaking rightly of me would speak.

original: Yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṁ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā tamahaṁ apagabbhoti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kho brāhmaṇaḥ āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā tam aham apagabbhā ti vadāmi
translated: One who has given up future rebirth in the womb, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it so that it’s no more subject to future arising—he’s what I call ‘free from rebirth in the womb’.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṁ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho brāhmaṇaḥ āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Realized One has given up future rebirth in the womb, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it so that it’s no more subject to future arising.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyo yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—‘apagabbho samaṇo gotamo’ti, no ca kho yaṁ tvaṁ sandhāya vadesi.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi
translated: This is the method by which one speaking rightly of me would say: ‘The ascetic Gotama is free from rebirth in the womb.’ But that’s not what you meant when you said it.

original: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api brāhmaṇa kukkuṭiyāḥ aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā
translated: Suppose a hen had eight, ten, or twelve eggs,

original: Tānassu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni.
analyzed: kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni
translated: and she sat on them properly, warmed them properly, and incubated them properly.

original: Yo nu kho tesaṁ kukkuṭacchāpakānaṁ paṭhamataraṁ pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena
analyzed: yaḥ nu kho tesam kukkuṭa chāpakānam paṭhamataram pāda nakha sikhāya vā mukha tuṇḍakena
translated: Which of those chicks would first peck at the eggshell with its claw or beak?”

original: vā aṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyya, kinti svāssa vacanīyo—‘jeṭṭho vā kaniṭṭho vā’”ti?
analyzed: vā aṇḍa kosam padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyya kinti vā assa vacanīya jeṭṭhaḥ vā kaniṭṭhaḥ vā ati
translated: or if he were to break out of the eggshell safely and without injury, would he be called the eldest or the youngest?”

original: “Jeṭṭhotissa, bho gotama, vacanīyo.
analyzed: jeṭṭhotissa bho gotama vacanīyaḥ
translated: “He would be called the eldest, Master Gotama.

original: So hi nesaṁ jeṭṭho hotī”ti.
analyzed: saḥ hi na esam jeṭṭhaḥ hoti iti
translated: For he is the eldest of them.”

original: “Evameva kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, avijjāgatāya pajāya aṇḍabhūtāya pariyonaddhāya avijjaṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā ekova loke anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho.
analyzed: evam eva khalu aha brāhmaṇa avid jāgatāya pajāya aṇḍa bhūtāya pariyonaddhāya avid jaṇḍa kosam padāletvā ekaḥ iva loke anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: “In the same way, brahmin, I have broken out of the eggshell of ignorance that encloses and envelops the generation that wanders and transmigrates, and I have awakened to the supreme perfect enlightenment alone in the world.

original: Svāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, jeṭṭho seṭṭho lokassa.🔽Āraddhaṁ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṁ ahosi asallīnaṁ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṁ cittaṁ ekaggaṁ.
analyzed: svāha brāhmaṇa jeṭṭhaḥ seṭṭhaḥ lokassa  āraddham kho pana me brāhmaṇa vīriyam ahosi a sallīnaḥ upaṭṭhitā sati a sammuṭṭhā passaddhaḥ kāyaḥ a sāraddhaḥ samāhitam cittam ekagga
translated: I am the eldest and best in the world.🔽My energy was aroused and unshaken, my mindfulness was established and unconfused, my body was tranquil and undisturbed, my mind was concentrated and one-pointed.

original: So kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha brāhmaṇa vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I entered upon and abided in the first jhāna, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.🔽Pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsiṁ sato ca sampajāno, sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedesiṁ, yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti—
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi  pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsim sataḥ ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedesi yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti
translated: With the stilling of directed thoughts & evaluations, I entered & remained in the second jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of concentration, unification of awareness free from directed thought & evaluation — internal assurance.

original: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: upekkhako satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: With the fading of rapture, I remained equanimous, mindful, & alert, and sensed pleasure with the body. I entered & remained in the third jhāna, of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous & mindful, he has a pleasant abiding.’

original: Sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure & pain — as with the earlier disappearance of elation & distress — I entered & remained in the fourth jhāna: purity of equanimity & mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: When the mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, & attained to imperturbability, I directed it to the knowledge of recollecting my past lives.

original: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: saḥ aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: I recollected my manifold past lives, i.e., one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction & expansion: ‘There I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity, such my experience of pleasure & pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose there. There too I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity, such my experience of pleasure & pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose here.’ Thus I remembered my manifold past lives in their modes & details.

original: ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo
analyzed: ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ tisso api jātiyaḥ catasso pi jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ
translated: one birth, two, three, four, five,

original: vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi,
analyzed: vīsampi jātiyo tisampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyaḥ jāti satampi
translated: ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty,

original: jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi, anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi🔽saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe—🔽‘amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto;🔽so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ;
analyzed: jāti sahassam pi jāti sata sahassam pi aneke pi savaṭṭa kappe aneke pi vivaṭṭa kappe aneke pi  sa vaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe  amutra asim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyantaḥ  saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi
translated: a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand,🔽many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and evolution.

original: tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto;🔽so tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti.🔽Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyantaḥ  saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapannoti  iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: I remember many different past lives, with their characteristics and particulars.🔽This was my first true knowledge.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā,
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā
translated: At dawn, when the night was over,

original: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ
translated: ignorance was destroyed, knowledge arose, darkness was destroyed, light arose—🔽

original: yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: yathā tam appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose — just as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamābhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa paṭhamā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā
translated: This was my first breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate, yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi—
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāmi
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions thus:

original: ‘ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā;
analyzed: ime vata bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatāḥ vacī duccaritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikāḥ micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānāḥ
translated: ‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapannā
translated: after death, at the breaking-up of the body, have reappeared in a lower realm, a bad destination, a world of suffering, hell.

original: Ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā;
analyzed: ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā
translated: But these venerable beings, endowed with bodily good conduct, verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct, who did not revile noble ones, who held right views and undertook actions under the influence of right views,

original: te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati
translated: after death, at the breaking-up of the body, have reappeared in a good destination, a heavenly world.’

original: Iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate, yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi.
analyzed: iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāmi
translated: Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I see beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā,🔽avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā  avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ
translated: This, brahmin, was the second knowledge I attained in the last watch of the night.

original: yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: yathā tam appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was dispelled and knowledge arose; darkness was dispelled and light arose, as happens in one who abides diligent, ardent, and resolute.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, dutiyābhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa dutiyā abhinibbhidā ahosi kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā
translated: This was my second breakthrough, like the chick breaking out of the eggshell.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ🔽abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  so idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūta  abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: “When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ;🔽‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ,
analyzed: paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam  ime āsavā ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati 🔽yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘These are the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Tassa me evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha.
analyzed: tassa me evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccittha bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccittha avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccittha
translated: When I knew and saw this, my mind was freed from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ahosi
translated: When it was freed, I knew it was freed.

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: I directly knew: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā,
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the third true insight, brahmin, that I attained in the last watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose—

original: yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: yathā tam appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato
translated: as happens for one who abides diligent, ardent, and resolute.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, tatiyābhinibbhidā ahosi—kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa tatiya abhinibbhidā ahosikukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamha ati
translated: This was my third breakthrough, like the chick breaking out of the eggshell.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: evam vutte verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin of Verañjā said to the Lord:

original: “jeṭṭho bhavaṁ gotamo, seṭṭho bhavaṁ gotamo.
analyzed: jeṭṭhaḥ bhavam gotamo seṭṭhaḥ bhavam gotamo
translated: “Master Gotama is the elder, Master Gotama is the best.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: Excellent, Master Gotama, excellent!

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya—‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as one might set upright what has been overturned, or reveal what is hidden, or show the way to one who is lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Lord Gotama made the Dhamma clear in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to the Lord Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gataṁ.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gata
translated: May the Lord Gotama accept me as a lay-follower gone to him for refuge, from this day forth, for as long as life lasts.

original: Adhivāsetu ca me bhavaṁ gotamo verañjāyaṁ vassāvāsaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu ca me bhavam gotamaḥ verañjāyam vassa āvāsam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: And may the Lord Gotama consent to take a meal from me tomorrow with the Sangha of bhikkhus.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Lord consented by silence.

original: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Then the brahmin of Verañjā, understanding his consent, rose from his seat, respectfully saluted the Lord and, keeping his right side towards him, took leave of him.

original: Tena kho pana samayena verañjā dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena verañjā dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetu
translated: Now at that time Verañjā was short of food and afflicted with hunger, the country suffering from a dearth of normal food, with crops affected by whiteheads, turning to straw. It was not easy to get by on almsfood.

original: Tena kho pana samayena uttarāpathakā assavāṇijā pañcamattehi assasatehi verañjaṁ vassāvāsaṁ upagatā honti.🔽Tehi assamaṇḍalikāsu bhikkhūnaṁ patthapatthapulakaṁ paññattaṁ hoti.🔽Bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya verañjaṁ piṇḍāya pavisitvā piṇḍaṁ
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena uttarāpathakāḥ assa vāṇijāḥ pañca mattehi assa satehi verañjam vassāvāsam upagatāḥ honti  tehi assa maṇḍalikāsu bhikkhūnam pattha pattha pulakam paññattam hoti  bhikkhū pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya verañjam piṇḍāya pavisitvā piṇḍa
translated: Now at that time merchants from Uttarāpatha, having five hundred horses, had taken up residence in Verañjā for the rainy season.🔽In the horse-training yards they had set up for the monks a supply of chaff and husks.🔽Then, having gone for alms in Verañjā, the monks, getting nothing, returned with their alms as they had gone.

original: alabhamānā assamaṇḍalikāsu piṇḍāya caritvā patthapatthapulakaṁ ārāmaṁ āharitvā udukkhale🔽koṭṭetvā koṭṭetvā paribhuñjanti.
analyzed: a labhamānā assa maṇḍalikāsu piṇḍāya caritvā pattha pattha pulakam ārāmam āharitvā udukkhale  koṭṭetvā koṭṭetvā paribhuñjanti
translated: Then, having pounded the chaff and husks in mortars, they cooked it in a cauldron and ate it.

original: Āyasmā panānando patthapulakaṁ silāyaṁ pisitvā bhagavato upanāmeti. Taṁ bhagavā paribhuñjati.
analyzed: āyasmā pana ānandaḥ pattha pulakam silāyam pisitvā bhagavataḥ upanāma iti tam bhagavā paribhuñjati
translated: But the venerable Ānanda pounded the chaff and husks on a stone and brought it to the Blessed One, who ate it.

original: Assosi kho bhagavā udukkhalasaddaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā udukkhalasadda
translated: The Blessed One heard the sound of the mortar.

original: Jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchanti, jānantāpi na pucchanti;
analyzed: jānantā api tathāgatā pucchanti jānantā api na pucchanti
translated: The Tathāgatas know what is past, know what is future, and know what is present. Knowing, the Tathāgatas speak what is appropriate to the present time, what is in accordance with the truth, what is in accordance with the Dhamma, what is in accordance with the discipline. Therefore the Tathāgatas are called ‘the awakened ones.’

original: kālaṁ viditvā pucchanti, kālaṁ viditvā na pucchanti;
analyzed: kālam viditvā pucchanti kālam viditvā na pucchanti
translated: They ask when it’s the right time, and not when it’s the wrong time.

original: atthasaṁhitaṁ tathāgatā pucchanti, no anatthasaṁhitaṁ.🔽Anatthasaṁhite setughāto tathāgatānaṁ.
analyzed: attha sahitam tathāgatāḥ pucchanti no anattha sahita  anattha sahite setu ghāto tathāgatāna
translated: They ask what’s connected with the goal, not what’s unconnected.🔽The Buddhas have no need for what’s unconnected.

original: Dvīhi ākārehi buddhā bhagavanto bhikkhū paṭipucchanti— dhammaṁ vā desessāma, sāvakānaṁ vā sikkhāpadaṁ paññapessāmāti.
analyzed: dvīhi ākārehi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhikkhū paṭipucchanti dhammam vā desessāma sāvakānam vā sikkhāpadam paññapessāma ati
translated: There are two reasons why the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, question the monks: to give a teaching or to lift a training rule.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—“kiṁ nu kho so, ānanda, udukkhalasaddo”ti?
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi kim nu kho saḥ ānanda udukkhala saddaḥ ti
translated: The Buddha said to Ānanda, “What’s that noise, Ānanda?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: Ānanda told him.

original: “Sādhu sādhu, ānanda.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu ānanda
translated: “Good, good, Ānanda.

original: Tumhehi, ānanda, sappurisehi vijitaṁ. Pacchimā janatā sālimaṁsodanaṁ atimaññissatī”ti.
analyzed: tumhehi ānanda sappurisehi vijita pacchimā janatā sālimasodanam atimaññissati iti
translated: You good people have won. The people of the future will look down on rice and curry.”🔽Mahāmoggallāna then went to the Buddha, bowed,

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ🔽abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavanta 🔽abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: sat down, and said,

original: “etarahi, bhante, verañjā dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā.
analyzed: etarahi bhante verañjā dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā
translated: “At present, Venerable Sir, Verañjā is short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw.

original: Na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṁ.
analyzed: na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetu
translated: It’s not easy to get by on almsfood.

original: Imissā, bhante, mahāpathaviyā heṭṭhimatalaṁ sampannaṁ—seyyathāpi khuddamadhuṁ anīlakaṁ; evamassādaṁ.
analyzed: imissāḥ bhante mahā pathaviyāḥ heṭṭhima talam sampanna seyyathā api khudda madhum anīlakaḥ evam assāda
translated: The lower surface of this great earth is as rich and fertile as red rice, and as sweet and tasty as pure wild honey.

original: Sādhāhaṁ, bhante, pathaviṁ parivatteyyaṁ. Bhikkhū pappaṭakojaṁ paribhuñjissantī”ti.
analyzed: sādhā aha bhante pathavim parivatteyya bhikkhū pappaṭaka ojam paribhuñjissanti iti
translated: It would be good if I could turn the earth upside down. The monks could eat the earth’s crust.”

original: “Ye pana te, moggallāna, pathavinissitā pāṇā te kathaṁ karissasī”ti?
analyzed: ye pana te moggallāna patha vinissitā pāṇā te katham karissasi iti
translated: “But what about the creatures that live in the earth?”

original: “Ekāhaṁ, bhante, pāṇiṁ abhinimminissāmi—seyyathāpi mahāpathavī. Ye pathavinissitā pāṇā te tattha saṅkāmessāmi.🔽Ekena hatthena pathaviṁ parivattessāmī”ti.
analyzed: ekāha bhante pāṇim abhinimminissāmi seyyathā api mahā pathavī ye pathavi nissitā pāṇā te tattha saṅkāmessāmi  ekena hatthena pathavim parivattessāmi iti
translated: “I’ll make a hand as big as the great earth and I’ll turn it over with that.”

original: “Alaṁ, moggallāna, mā te rucci pathaviṁ parivattetuṁ.
analyzed: ala moggallāna mā te rucci pathavim parivattetu
translated: “Enough, Moggallāna. Don’t think of turning the earth upside down.

original: Vipallāsampi sattā paṭilabheyyun”ti.
analyzed: vipallāsam pi sattā paṭilabheyyunti
translated: It would lead to the confusion of beings.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante, sabbo bhikkhusaṅgho uttarakuruṁ piṇḍāya gaccheyyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante sabbaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ uttarakurum piṇḍāya gaccheyya ati
translated: “It would be good if the whole Sangha of monks could go to Uttarakuru for alms.”

original: “Alaṁ, moggallāna, mā te rucci sabbassa bhikkhusaṅghassa uttarakuruṁ piṇḍāya gamanan”ti.
analyzed: ala moggallāna mā te rucci sabbassa bhikkhu saṅghassa uttarakurum piṇḍāya gamanan ti
translated: “Enough, Moggallāna. Don’t ask for the entire Sangha of monks to go to Uttarakuru for alms.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Then, while reflecting in private, Venerable Sāriputta thought,

original: “katamesānaṁ kho buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ brahmacariyaṁ na ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosi;
analyzed: katamesānam kho buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam na cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi
translated: “Which Buddhas’ spiritual lives didn’t last long?

original: katamesānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ brahmacariyaṁ ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti?
analyzed: katamesānam buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam ciraṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: And which Buddhas’ spiritual lives lasted long?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: In the evening Sāriputta came out of seclusion and went to the Buddha.🔽He bowed, sat down,

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā🔽sāriputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā  sāriputtaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and told the Buddha what he had been thinking.

original: “idha mayhaṁ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: idha bhante rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: “Sāriputta, the spiritual life established by these Buddhas didn’t last long:

original: ‘katamesānaṁ kho buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ brahmacariyaṁ na ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosi, katamesānaṁ🔽buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ brahmacariyaṁ ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī’ti. Katamesānaṁ nu kho,
analyzed: katamesānam kho buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam na cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi  buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi iti katamesānam nu kho
translated: ‘Which Buddhas’ spiritual lives did not last long,

original: bhante, buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ brahmacariyaṁ na ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosi, katamesānaṁ
analyzed: bhante buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam na cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi
translated: and which Buddhas’ spiritual lives lasted long?’ Which Buddhas’ spiritual lives did not last long,

original: buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ brahmacariyaṁ ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti?
analyzed: buddhānam bhagavantānam brahmacariyam ciraṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: and which Buddhas’ spiritual lives lasted long?”

original: “Bhagavato ca, sāriputta, vipassissa bhagavato ca sikhissa bhagavato ca vessabhussa brahmacariyaṁ na ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca sāriputta vipassissa bhagavataḥ ca sikhissa bhagavataḥ ca vessabhussa brahmacariyam na cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi
translated: “Sāriputta, the spiritual lives of the Buddhas Vipassī, Sikhī, and Vessabhū did not last long.

original: Bhagavato ca, sāriputta, kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyaṁ ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca sāriputta kakusandhassa bhagavataḥ ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavataḥ ca kassapassa brahmacariyam cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: The spiritual lives of the Buddhas Kakusandha, Koṇāgamana, and Kassapa lasted long.”

original: “Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena bhagavato ca vipassissa bhagavato ca sikhissa bhagavato ca vessabhussa brahmacariyaṁ na ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena bhagavataḥ ca vipassissa bhagavataḥ ca sikhissa bhagavataḥ ca vessabhussa brahmacariyam na ciraṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: “What was the reason, Lord, what was the cause, why the spiritual life established by Master Vipassī, Master Sikhī and Master Vesabhū did not last long?”

original: “Bhagavā ca, sāriputta, vipassī bhagavā ca sikhī bhagavā ca vessabhū kilāsuno ahesuṁ sāvakānaṁ vitthārena dhammaṁ desetuṁ.🔽Appakañca nesaṁ ahosi suttaṁ geyyaṁ veyyākaraṇaṁ gāthā udānaṁ itivuttakaṁ jātakaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ vedallaṁ.
analyzed: bhagavā ca sāriputta vipassī bhagavā ca sikhī bhagavā ca vessabhū kilāsunaḥ ahesum sāvakānam vitthārena dhammam desetu  appakam ca na isam ahosi suttam geyyam veyyākaraṇam gāthāḥ udānam itivuttakam jātakam abbhuta dhammam vedalla
translated: “Sāriputta, Master Vipassī, Master Sikhī and Master Vesabhū were not skilled in instructing the disciples in the higher austerity,🔽and they had little of the Suttas, songs, explanations, verses, exclamations, sayings, birth stories, amazing accounts and miscellanies.

original: Apaññattaṁ sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ. Anuddiṭṭhaṁ pātimokkhaṁ.
analyzed: a paññattam sāvakānam sikkhāpada an uddiṭṭham pātimokkha
translated: They did not lay down training rules for their disciples, nor did they recite a monastic code.

original: Tesaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṁ sāvakānaṁ antaradhānena
analyzed: tesam buddhānam bhagavantānam antaradhānena buddha anubuddhānam sāvakānam antaradhānena
translated: And with the passing of those Buddhas, those Masters, and of their disciples,

original: ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā te taṁ brahmacariyaṁ
analyzed: ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānā nāmāḥ nānā gottāḥ nānā jaccāḥ nānā kulā pabbajitā te tam brahmacariya
translated: the last of those disciples, of various names, clans, and social strata, who had gone forth from various families,

original: khippaññeva antaradhāpesuṁ.
analyzed: khippaññā iva antaradhāpesu
translated: quickly caused that spiritual life to disappear.

original: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, nānāpupphāni phalake nikkhittāni suttena asaṅgahitāni tāni vāto vikirati vidhamati viddhaṁseti.🔽Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: seyyathā api sāriputta nānā pupphāni phalake nikkhittāni suttena asaṅgahitāni tāni vātaḥ vikirati vidhamati viddha seti  tam kim sa hetu
translated: Just as various flowers placed on a flat board, not bound together by a thread, would be scattered and dispersed by the wind,

original: Yathā taṁ suttena asaṅgahitattā.🔽Evameva kho, sāriputta, tesaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṁ
analyzed: yathā tam suttena a saṅgahita ttā  evam eva kho sāriputta tesam buddhānam bhagavantānam antaradhānena buddha anubuddhāna
translated: so it is because they were not bound together by a thread.🔽In the same way, Sāriputta, with the disappearance of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the disappearance of their disciples, the last disciples of those who were disciples of those Buddhas,

original: sāvakānaṁ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā
analyzed: sāvakānaṃ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakāḥ nānā nāmāḥ nānā gottāḥ nānā jaccāḥ nānā kulā
translated: who had various names, various clans, various social strata,

original: pabbajitā te taṁ brahmacariyaṁ khippaññeva antaradhāpesuṁ.
analyzed: pabbajitā te tam brahmacariyam khippaññā iva antaradhāpesu
translated: quickly caused that spiritual life to disappear.

original: Akilāsuno ca te bhagavanto ahesuṁ sāvake cetasā ceto paricca ovadituṁ.
analyzed: a kilāsunaḥ ca te bhagavantaḥ ahesum sāvake cetasā cetaḥ paricca ovaditu
translated: Those Blessed Ones were not tired of advising their disciples with their minds.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, sāriputta, vessabhū bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho aññatarasmiṁ bhiṁsanake vanasaṇḍe sahassaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ cetasā ceto paricca ovadati anusāsati—
analyzed: bhūta pubba sāriputta vessabhū bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ aññatarasmim bhisanake vanasaṇḍe sahassam bhikkhu saṅgham cetasā cetaḥ paricca ovadati anusāsati
translated: Sāriputta, it so happened that the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Vessabhū, in a certain terrifying jungle thicket, advised and instructed a community of a thousand monks with his mind.

original: ‘evaṁ vitakketha, mā evaṁ vitakkayittha;
analyzed: evam vitakketha mā evam vitakkayittha
translated: ‘Think like this, not like that;

original: evaṁ manasikarotha, mā evaṁ manasākattha;
analyzed: evam manasikarotha mā evam manasā akattha
translated: You should pay attention like this, not like that;

original: idaṁ pajahatha, idaṁ upasampajja viharathā’ti.
analyzed: idam pajahatha idam upasampajja viharatha ati
translated: you should abandon this, and you should enter and dwell in this.’

original: Atha kho, sāriputta, tassa bhikkhusahassassa vessabhunā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena evaṁ ovadiyamānānaṁ evaṁ anusāsiyamānānaṁ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho sāriputta tassa bhikkhu sahassassa vessabhunā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena evam ovadiyamānānam evam anusāsiyamānānam an upādāya āsavehi cittāni
translated: Then, Sāriputta, as the thousand monks were being admonished and instructed by the Buddha Vessabhū, their minds were freed from the corruptions through letting go.

original: Tatra sudaṁ, sāriputta, bhiṁsanakassa vanasaṇḍassa bhiṁsanakatasmiṁ hoti—yo koci avītarāgo taṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ pavisati, yebhuyyena lomāni haṁsanti.
analyzed: tatra suda sāriputta bhisanakassa vana saṇḍassa bhisanakatasmin hotiyaḥ koci a vīta rāgaḥ tam vana saṇḍam pavisati yebhuyyena lomāni hasanti
translated: And in that terrifying forest grove there was a terrifying quality such that anyone who entered it who was not free of passion would get the shivers all over.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sāriputta, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena bhagavato ca vipassissa bhagavato ca sikhissa bhagavato ca vessabhussa brahmacariyaṁ na ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho sāriputta hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena bhagavataḥ ca vipassissa bhagavataḥ ca sikhissa bhagavataḥ ca vessabhussa brahmacariyam na cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: This is the reason, Sāriputta, this is the cause why the spiritual life established by those Buddhas did not last long.”

original: “Ko pana, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena bhagavato ca kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyaṁ ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena bhagavato ca kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyam cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: “But what was the cause, what was the reason why the spiritual life established by those three Buddhas lasted so long?”

original: “Bhagavā ca, sāriputta, kakusandho bhagavā ca koṇāgamano bhagavā ca kassapo akilāsuno ahesuṁ sāvakānaṁ vitthārena dhammaṁ desetuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavā ca sāriputta kakusandhaḥ bhagavā ca koṇāgamanaḥ bhagavā ca kassapaḥ akilāsunaḥ ahesum sāvakānam vitthārena dhammam desetu
translated: “The Buddhas Kakusandha, Konāgamana, and Kassapa were not tired of teaching the Dhamma in detail to their disciples.

original: Bahuñca nesaṁ ahosi suttaṁ geyyaṁ veyyākaraṇaṁ gāthā udānaṁ itivuttakaṁ jātakaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ vedallaṁ,
analyzed: bahun ca nesam ahosi suttam geyyam veyyākaraṇam gāthāḥ udānam itivuttakam jātakam abbhuta dhammam vedalla
translated: They had a great deal of suttas, songs, explanations, verses, exclamations, quotations, birth stories, amazing accounts, and analyses.

original: paññattaṁ sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ, uddiṭṭhaṁ pātimokkhaṁ.
analyzed: paññattam sāvakānam sikkhāpade uddiṭṭham pātimokkha
translated: They laid down training rules for their disciples and recited a monastic code.

original: Tesaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṁ sāvakānaṁ antaradhānena
analyzed: tesam buddhānam bhagavantānam antaradhānena buddha anubuddhānam sāvakānam antaradhānena
translated: With the disappearance of those Buddhas, those Buddhas’ disciples, the Buddhas’ disciples’ disciples,

original: ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā te taṁ brahmacariyaṁ
analyzed: ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānā nāmāḥ nānā gottāḥ nānā jaccāḥ nānā kulā pabbajitā te tam brahmacariya
translated: the last disciples, of various names, clans, and social strata, who had gone forth from various families,

original: ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ ṭhapesuṁ.
analyzed: ciram dīgham addhānam ṭhapesu
translated: maintained the spiritual life for a long time.

original: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, nānāpupphāni phalake nikkhittāni suttena susaṅgahitāni, tāni vāto na vikirati na vidhamati na viddhaṁseti.
analyzed: seyyathā api sāriputta nānā pupphāni phalake nikkhittāni suttena su saṅgahitāni tāni vātaḥ na vikirati na vidhamati na viddha seti
translated: It’s like various flowers placed on a tray, well-fastened with thread. The wind doesn’t scatter or disperse or destroy them.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Yathā taṁ suttena susaṅgahitattā.🔽Evameva kho, sāriputta, tesaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ antaradhānena buddhānubuddhānaṁ
analyzed: yathā tam suttena su saṅgahita ttā  evam eva kho sāriputta tesam buddhānam bhagavantānam antaradhānena buddha anubuddhāna
translated: Because they’re well-fastened with thread.🔽In the same way, Sāriputta, with the disappearance of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the disappearance of their disciples, the disciples of the disciples of those Buddhas,

original: sāvakānaṁ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakā nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā
analyzed: sāvakānaṃ antaradhānena ye te pacchimā sāvakāḥ nānā nāmāḥ nānā gottāḥ nānā jaccāḥ nānā kulā
translated: the last disciples of various names, various clans, various social classes,

original: pabbajitā te taṁ brahmacariyaṁ ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ ṭhapesuṁ.
analyzed: pabbajitā te tam brahmacariyam ciram dīgham addhānam
translated: established that spiritual life for a long time.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sāriputta, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena bhagavato ca kakusandhassa bhagavato ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavato ca kassapassa brahmacariyaṁ ciraṭṭhitikaṁ ahosī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho sāriputta hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena bhagavataḥ ca kakusandhassa bhagavataḥ ca koṇāgamanassa bhagavataḥ ca kassapassa brahmacariyam cira ṭṭhitikam ahosi iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why the spiritual life established by the Buddha Kakusandha, the Buddha Koṇāgamana, and the Buddha Kassapa lasted long.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Sāriputta got up from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and said to the Buddha,🔽“Venerable Sir, I would like to ask about a certain point, if you would grant me the opportunity.”

original: “etassa, bhagavā, kālo. Etassa, sugata, kālo.
analyzed: etassa bhagavā kālaḥ etassa sugata kālaḥ
translated: “Now is the time, Blessed One, now is the time, Sublime One,

original: Yaṁ bhagavā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeyya, uddiseyya pātimokkhaṁ, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikan”ti.
analyzed: yam bhagavā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeyya uddiseyya pātimokkha yathayidam brahmacariyam addhaniyam assa cira ṭṭhitikam ti
translated: for the Blessed One to lay down the training rules for his disciples and recite the Pāṭimokkha, so that this holy life will long endure and be established for a long time, and so that it will be for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans.”

original: “Āgamehi tvaṁ, sāriputta. Āgamehi tvaṁ, sāriputta.
analyzed: āgamehi tva sāriputta āgamehi tva sāriputta
translated: “Wait, Sāriputta, wait, Sāriputta.

original: Tathāgatova tattha kālaṁ jānissati.🔽Na tāva, sāriputta, satthā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeti uddisati pātimokkhaṁ yāva🔽na idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti. Yato ca kho, sāriputta, idhekacce
analyzed: tathāgataḥ uva tattha kālam jānissati  na tāva sāriputta satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti uddisati pātimokkham yāva  na idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti yatas ca kho sāriputta idha ekacce
translated: The Tathāgata himself knows the right time.🔽The Teacher doesn’t lay down the training rules for his disciples and recite the Pāṭimokkha🔽until there are in the Saṅgha some things that are the basis for taints. But when there are in the Saṅgha some things that are the basis for taints,

original: āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeti
analyzed: āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti atha satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti
translated: then the Teacher lays down the training rules for his disciples and recites the Pāṭimokkha

original: uddisati pātimokkhaṁ tesaṁyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya.
analyzed: uddisati pātimokkham āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam paṭighātāya
translated: for the purpose of warding off those things that are the basis for taints.

original: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti yāva na saṅgho rattaññumahattaṁ patto hoti.
analyzed: na tāva sāriputta idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti yāva na saṅghaḥ rattaññu mahattam pattaḥ hoti
translated: “Sariputta, as long as the Sangha has not reached greatness in terms of years, some things that are grounds for taints appear in the Sangha.

original: Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho rattaññumahattaṁ patto hoti atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā🔽dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeti uddisati
analyzed: yatas ca kho sāriputta saṅghaḥ rattaññu mahattam pattaḥ hoti atha idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyā  dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti atha satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti uddisati
translated: “Sāriputta, as long as the Sangha has not reached maturity in terms of years,🔽then some things that are grounds for corruption become manifest in the Sangha.

original: pātimokkhaṁ tesaṁyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya.🔽Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, yāva na saṅgho vepullamahattaṁ patto hoti.
analyzed: pātimokkham āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam paṭighātāya  na tāva sāriputta idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti yāva na saṅghaḥ vepulla mahattam pattaḥ hoti
translated: Then the Teacher lays down training rules for his disciples and recites them.🔽This is for the purpose of countering those things that are grounds for corruption.

original: Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho vepullamahattaṁ patto hoti, atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā🔽dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeti uddisati
analyzed: yatas ca kho sāriputta saṅghaḥ vepulla mahattam pattaḥ hoti atha idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyā  dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti atha satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti uddisati
translated: “Sāriputta, as long as the Sangha has not reached maturity in terms of numbers,🔽then some things that are grounds for corruption become manifest in the Sangha.

original: pātimokkhaṁ tesaṁyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya.
analyzed: pātimokkham āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam paṭighātāya
translated: Then the Teacher lays down training rules for his disciples and recites them.🔽This is for the purpose of countering those things that are grounds for corruption.

original: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, yāva na saṅgho lābhaggamahattaṁ patto hoti.🔽Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho lābhaggamahattaṁ patto hoti, atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā
analyzed: na tāva sāriputta idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti yāva na saṅghaḥ lābha gga mahattam pattaḥ hoti  yatas ca kho sāriputta saṅghaḥ lābha gga mahattam pattaḥ hoti atha idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyā
translated: “Sāriputta, as long as the Sangha has not attained gain and honor,🔽then some things that are a basis for pollutants become manifest in the Sangha.

original: dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeti uddisati
analyzed: dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti atha satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti uddisati
translated: Then the Teacher lays down training rules for his disciples and recites them.

original: pātimokkhaṁ tesaṁyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya.
analyzed: pātimokkham āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam paṭighātāya
translated: This is for the purpose of countering those things that are a basis for pollutants.

original: Na tāva, sāriputta, idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, yāva na saṅgho bāhusaccamahattaṁ patto hoti.🔽Yato ca kho, sāriputta, saṅgho bāhusaccamahattaṁ patto hoti, atha idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā
analyzed: na tāva sāriputta idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti yāva na saṅghaḥ bāhu sacca mahattam pattaḥ hoti  yatas ca kho sāriputta saṅghaḥ bāhu sacca mahattam pattaḥ hoti atha idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyā
translated: “Sāriputta, as long as the Sangha has not attained great learning,🔽then some things that are a basis for pollutants become manifest in the Sangha.

original: dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti, atha satthā sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapeti uddisati
analyzed: dhammā saṅghe pātubhavanti atha satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti uddisati
translated: Then the Teacher lays down training rules for his disciples and recites them.

original: pātimokkhaṁ tesaṁyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya.
analyzed: pātimokkham āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam paṭighātāya
translated: This is for the purpose of countering those things that are a basis for pollutants.”

original: Nirabbudo hi, sāriputta, bhikkhusaṅgho nirādīnavo apagatakāḷako suddho sāre patiṭṭhito.
analyzed: nirabbudaḥ hi sāriputta bhikkhu saṅghaḥ nirādīnavaḥ apagata kāḷakaḥ suddhaḥ sāre patiṭṭhito
translated: The Sangha of monks is free from defilements, free from corruption, above reproach, and has established itself in the essence.”

original: Imesañhi, sāriputta, pañcannaṁ bhikkhusatānaṁ yo pacchimako bhikkhu so sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
analyzed: imesam hi sāriputta pañcannam bhikkhu satānam yaḥ pacchimakaḥ bhikkhu so sotāpannaḥ a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti
translated: The last of these five hundred monks is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the lower worlds, bound for awakening.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—“āciṇṇaṁ kho panetaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatānaṁ yehi nimantitā vassaṁ vasanti, na te anapaloketvā janapadacārikaṁ pakkamanti.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi āciṇṇam kho pana itas ānanda tathāgatānam yehi nimantitāḥ vassam vasanti na te an apaloketvā janapada cārikam pakkamanti
translated: The Buddha then said to Ānanda, “Ānanda, it’s the custom for Buddhas not to go wandering in the country without taking leave of their invitations.

original: Āyāmānanda, verañjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ apalokessāmā”ti.
analyzed: āyāma ānanda verañjam brāhmaṇam apalokessāma ati
translated: Let’s go to Verañjā and take leave of the brahmin.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchāsamaṇena yena verañjassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya āyasmatā ānandena pacchā samaṇena yena verañjassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and with Venerable Ānanda as his attendant, went to the brahmin’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha khalu verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: He then went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho verañjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ bhagavā etadavoca—“nimantitamha tayā, brāhmaṇa, vassaṁvuṭṭhā, apalokema taṁ,
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho verañjam brāhmaṇam bhagavā etat avoca tayā brāhmaṇa vassa vuṭṭhāḥ apalokema tam
translated: The Buddha said, “Brahmin, we’ve completed the rainy season residence you invited us to. We’re now going wandering.”

original: “icchāma mayaṁ janapadacārikaṁ pakkamitun”ti.🔽“Saccaṁ, bho gotama, nimantitattha mayā vassaṁvuṭṭhā; api ca yo deyyadhammo so na dinno.
analyzed: icchāma mayam janapada cārikam pakkamitum ti  sat ca bho gotama mayā vassa vuṭṭhā api ca yaḥ deyya dhammaḥ saḥ na dinnaḥ
translated: “We wish to go wandering in the country.”

original: Tañca kho no asantaṁ,
analyzed: tat ca khalu naḥ
translated: “It’s true that we’ve completed the rainy season residence you invited us to, but we haven’t received any gift you were going to give.🔽And that’s not because you’re unwilling to give.

original: nopi adātukamyatā, taṁ kutettha labbhā bahukiccā gharāvāsā bahukaraṇīyā.
analyzed: na upi a dātu kamya tā tam kuta ittha labbhā bahu kiccā ghara āvāsā bahu karaṇīyā
translated: It’s because we have many duties and responsibilities at home.

original: Adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: Please accept a meal from me tomorrow together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho bhagavā verañjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā verañjam brāhmaṇam dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening him with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: atha kho verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena sake nivesane paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālam ārocāpesi kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: When the night had passed, Verañjā had various kinds of fine food prepared in his own house. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena verañjassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.🔽Atha kho verañjo brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena verañjassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena  atha kho verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Verañjā’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.🔽Verañjā personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ticīvarena🔽acchādesi, ekamekañca bhikkhuṁ ekamekena dussayugena acchādesi.
analyzed: sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim ti cīvarena 🔽acchādesi ekam ekañca bhikkhum ekam ekena dussayugena acchādesi
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Verañjā had a set of three robes made for him and a set of two robes for each of the monks.

original: Atha kho bhagavā verañjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā verañjam brāhmaṇam dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Then the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened Verañjā with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā verañjāyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā anupagamma soreyyaṁ saṅkassaṁ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā verañjāyam yathā abhirantam viharitvā an upagamma soreyyam saṅkassa
translated: After staying at Verañjā for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out to wander by stages to Sāketa.

original: kaṇṇakujjaṁ yena payāgapatiṭṭhānaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā payāgapatiṭṭhāne
analyzed: kaṇṇakujjam yena payāga patiṭṭhānam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā payāga patiṭṭhāne
translated: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Deer Park in Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.

original: gaṅgaṁ nadiṁ uttaritvā yena bārāṇasī tadavasari.🔽Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena vesālī tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.
analyzed: gaṅgam nadim uttaritvā yena bārāṇasī tat avasari  atha khalu bhagavā bārāṇasiyam yathābhirantam viharitvā yena vesālī tena cārikam pakkāmi
translated: After staying at Sāketa for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Bārāṇasī.🔽When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Deer Park at Isipatana.

original: Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena vesālī tadavasari.
analyzed: anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena vesālī tat avasari
translated: After staying at Bārāṇasī for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Vesālī.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyanti.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāyanti
translated: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Verañjabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito.🔽Paṭhamapārājikasikkhāpada
analyzed: verañjabhāṇa vāraḥ niṭṭhito  paṭhama pārājika sikkhāpada
translated: The section for recitation on Verañjā is finished.🔽The first training rule on expulsion

original: 1. Sudinnabhāṇavāra
analyzed: sudinnabhāṇavāra
translated: The section for recitation on Sudinna

original: Tena kho pana samayena vesāliyā avidūre kalandagāmo nāma atthi. Tattha sudinno nāma kalandaputto seṭṭhiputto hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena vesāliyāḥ avidūre kalandagāmaḥ nāma atthi tattha sudinnaḥ nāma kalanda putto seṭṭhi putto hoti
translated: At that time, not far from Vesālī, there was a village called Kalanda. There lived a young brahmin called Sudinna, the son of a wealthy family.

original: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto sambahulehi sahāyakehi saddhiṁ vesāliṁ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: atha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda putto sambahulehi sahāyakehi saddhim vesālim agamāsi kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: One day Sudinna went to Vesālī with some friends on some business.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṁ desento nisinno hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivutaḥ dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti
translated: At that time the Buddha was sitting teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.

original: Addasa kho sudinno kalandaputto bhagavantaṁ mahatiyā parisāya parivutaṁ dhammaṁ desentaṁ nisinnaṁ. Disvānassa etadahosi—“yannūnāhampi dhammaṁ suṇeyyan”ti.
analyzed: addasa kho sudinnaḥ kalanda puttaḥ bhagavantam mahatiyā parisāya parivutam dhammam desentam nisinna disvānassa etat ahosiyat nūna aham pi dhammam suṇeyyanti
translated: Sudinna saw the Buddha sitting there, and he thought, “Why don’t I listen to the Teaching?”

original: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto yena sā parisā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda puttaḥ yena sā parisā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: He then went to that assembly and sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnassa kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa etadahosi—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnassa kho sudinnassa kalanda puttassa etat ahosi
translated: But while he was sitting there, he thought,

original: “yathā yathā kho ahaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ;
analyzed: yathā yathā kho aham bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness?”

original: Atha kho sā parisā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho sā parisā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahasitā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
