translated: Then the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened that assembly with a teaching. They got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto aciravuṭṭhitāya parisāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;🔽upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sudinno
analyzed: atha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda puttaḥ acira vuṭṭhitāya parisāya yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami  upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho sudinnaḥ
translated: Soon afterwards Sudinna went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: kalandaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: kalandaputtaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,🔽“Sir, as I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: “yathā yathāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ;
analyzed: yathā yathā āha bhante bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: icchāmahaṁ, bhante, kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaha bhante kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Pabbājetu maṁ bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: pabbājetu mama bhagavā iti
translated: Please let the Buddha give me the going forth.”

original: “Anuññātosi pana tvaṁ, sudinna, mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti?🔽“Na kho ahaṁ, bhante, anuññāto mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: anuññātaḥ asi pana tva sudinna mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati  na kho aha bhante anuññātaḥ mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “But have you been approved by your parents to go forth from the home life into homelessness?”🔽“No, Sir.”

original: “Na kho, sudinna, tathāgatā ananuññātaṁ mātāpitūhi puttaṁ pabbājentī”ti.
analyzed: na kho sudinna tathāgatāḥ an anuññātam mātā pitūhi puttam pabbājenti iti
translated: “The Buddha doesn’t give the going forth to anyone who hasn’t been approved by their parents.”

original: “Sohaṁ, bhante, tathā karissāmi yathā maṁ mātāpitaro anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: sā uha bhante tathā karissāmi yathā mama mātā pitaraḥ anujānissanti agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “Then I’ll do what I can to get my parents’ approval.”

original: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto vesāliyaṁ taṁ karaṇīyaṁ tīretvā yena kalandagāmo yena mātāpitaro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mātāpitaro etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda puttaḥ vesāliyam tam karaṇīyam tīretvā yena kalandagāmaḥ yena mātā pitaraḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mātā pitaraḥ etat avoca
translated: Sudinna then finished his business in Vesālī and went to his parents. He said to them,

original: “ammatātā, yathā yathāhaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ;

translated: “Mom, Dad, as I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: icchāmahaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Anujānātha maṁ agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.🔽Evaṁ vutte, sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro sudinnaṁ kalandaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ—

translated: Please give me your permission to go forth.”🔽His parents replied,

original: “tvaṁ khosi, tāta sudinna, amhākaṁ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato. Na tvaṁ, tāta sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.
analyzed: tvam kho asi tāta sudinna amhākam eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ sukha edhitaḥ sukha parihataḥ na tva tāta sudinna kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi
translated: “Sudinna, you’re our only child, dear and beloved. You’ve been brought up in comfort, not knowing hardship. You don’t know anything about suffering.

original: Maraṇenapi mayaṁ te akāmakā vinā bhavissāma
analyzed: maraṇena api mayam te akāmakāḥ vinā bhavissāma

analyzed: kim pana mayam tam jīvantam anujānissāma agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya
translated: so how could we allow you to go forth from the home life into homelessness?

original: Uṭṭhehi, tāta sudinna, bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca,
analyzed: uṭṭhehi tāta sudinna bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca
translated: Get up, dear Sudinna, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself,

original: bhuñjanto pivanto paricārento kāme paribhuñjanto puññāni karonto abhiramassu.
analyzed: bhuñjantaḥ pivantaḥ paricārentaḥ kāme paribhuñjantaḥ puññāni karontaḥ abhiramassu
translated: and while doing so, make merit.

original: Na taṁ mayaṁ anujānāma agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: na tam mayam anujānāma agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: We don’t allow you to go forth from the home life into homelessness.’

original: Tatiyampi kho sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho sudinnaḥ kalanda putto tuṇhī ahosi
translated: For a third time, Sudinna was silent.

original: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā yena sudinno kalandaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sudinnaṁ kalandaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho sudinnassa kalanda puttassa sahāyakāḥ yena sudinnaḥ kalanda putto tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā sudinnam kalanda puttam etat avocu
translated: Then Sudinna’s friends went to him and said,

original: “tvaṁ khosi, samma sudinna, mātāpitūnaṁ ekaputtako piyo manāpo sukhedhito sukhaparihato.
analyzed: tvam kho asi samma sudinna mātā pitūnam eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ sukha edhitaḥ sukha parihataḥ
translated: ‘You are your parents’ only child, dear Sudinna, loved and fondled and grown up in comfort.

original: Na tvaṁ, samma sudinna, kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi.
analyzed: na tva samma sudinna kiñci dukkhassa jānāsi
translated: You don’t know anything about suffering.

original: Maraṇenapi te mātāpitaro akāmakā vinā bhavissanti,
analyzed: maraṇena api te mātā pitaraḥ akāmakāḥ vinā bhavissanti
translated: Even if your parents were to die, they would not want to be separated from you,

original: kiṁ pana taṁ jīvantaṁ anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajāya.
analyzed: kim pana tam jīvantam anujānissanti agārasma anagāriyam pabbajāya
translated: so how could they allow you to go forth from the lay life to homelessness?

original: Uṭṭhehi, samma sudinna, bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca,
analyzed: uṭṭhehi samma sudinna bhuñja ca piva ca paricārehi ca
translated: Get up, dear Sudinna, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself,

original: bhuñjanto pivanto paricārento kāme paribhuñjanto puññāni karonto abhiramassu,
analyzed: bhuñjantaḥ pivantaḥ paricārentaḥ kāme paribhuñjantaḥ puññāni karontaḥ abhiramassu
translated: eat, drink, and enjoy yourself, making merit and having fun,

original: na taṁ mātāpitaro anujānissanti agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: na tam mātā pitaraḥ anujānissanti agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: because your parents won’t allow you to go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.🔽Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: evam vutte sudinnaḥ kalanda putto tuṇhī ahosi  dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: When this was said, Sudinna remained silent.

original: tatiyampi kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā sudinnaṁ kalandaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ—🔽“tvaṁ khosi, samma sudinna …pe…
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā sudinnam kalandaputtam etat avocuḥ  tvam kho asi samma sudinna pe
translated: A second and a third time they said the same thing,

original: tatiyampi kho sudinno kalandaputto tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho sudinnaḥ kalanda putto tuṇhī ahosi
translated: and a second and a third time Sudinna remained silent.🔽‘Then Sudinna’s friends went to his parents and said,

original: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā yena sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātāpitaro etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakāḥ yena sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātā pitaraḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā sudinnassa kalandaputtassa mātā pitaraḥ etat avocu
translated: Sudinna’s friends then went to his parents and said,

original: “ammatātā, eso sudinno anantarahitāya bhūmiyā nipanno—
analyzed: ammatātā esaḥ su dinnaḥ anantara hitāya bhūmiyā nipannaḥ
translated: “Mom, Dad, Sudinna is lying down on the bare floor, saying,

original: ‘idheva me maraṇaṁ bhavissati pabbajjā vā’ti.
analyzed: idha iva me maraṇam bhavissati pabbajjā vā ati
translated: ‘Either I’ll die right here or I’ll go forth.’

original: Sace tumhe sudinnaṁ nānujānissatha agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya, tattheva maraṇaṁ āgamissati.
analyzed: sace tumhe sudinnam na anujānissatha agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya tattha iva maraṇam āgamissati
translated: If you don’t give him permission to go forth, he’ll die right there.

original: Sace pana tumhe sudinnaṁ anujānissatha agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya, pabbajitampi naṁ dakkhissatha.
analyzed: sace pana tumhe sudinnam anujānissatha agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya pabbajitam pi nam dakkhissatha
translated: But if you give him permission, you’ll still see him.

original: Sace sudinno nābhiramissati agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya, kā tassa aññā gati bhavissati, idheva paccāgamissati.
analyzed: sace sudinnaḥ na abhiramissati agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya kā tassa aññā gati bhavissati idha iva paccāgamissati
translated: If he doesn’t enjoy the going forth, he’ll come back.

original: Anujānātha sudinnaṁ agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: anujānātha sudinnam agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: So give him permission to go forth.”

original: “Anujānāma, tātā, sudinnaṁ agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: anujānāma tātā sudinnam agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “We give him permission.”

original: Atha kho sudinnassa kalandaputtassa sahāyakā yena sudinno kalandaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sudinnaṁ kalandaputtaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho sudinnassa kalanda puttassa sahāyakāḥ yena sudinnaḥ kalanda putto tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā sudinnam kalanda puttam etat avocu
translated: Sudinna’s friends then went to him and said,

original: “uṭṭhehi, samma sudinna, anuññātosi mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: uṭṭhehi samma sudinna anuññātaḥ asi mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “Get up, Sudinna. Your parents have given their permission for you to go forth.”

original: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto—“anuññātomhi kira mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti, haṭṭho udaggo pāṇinā gattāni paripuñchanto vuṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda putto anuññātaḥ amhi kira mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati haṭṭhaḥ udaggaḥ pāṇinā gattāni paripuñchantaḥ vuṭṭhāsi
translated: “So my parents have given their permission!” Sudinna got up, elated and joyful, and he rubbed his limbs with his hands.

original: Atha kho sudinno kalandaputto katipāhaṁ balaṁ gāhetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: atha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda putto katipāham balam gāhetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: After a few days, he regained his strength and went to the Buddha.

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sudinno
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho sudinnaḥ
translated: He bowed, sat down,

original: kalandaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: kalandaputtaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “anuññāto ahaṁ, bhante, mātāpitūhi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya.
analyzed: anuññātaḥ aha bhante mātā pitūhi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya
translated: “Sir, my parents have given their permission for me to go forth.

original: Pabbājetu maṁ bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: pabbājetu mama bhagavā iti
translated: Please give me the going forth.”

original: Alattha kho sudinno kalandaputto bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: alattha kho sudinnaḥ kalanda putto bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada
translated: Sudinna received the going forth and the full ordination in the presence of the Buddha.

original: Acirūpasampanno ca panāyasmā sudinno evarūpe dhutaguṇe samādāya vattati, āraññiko hoti piṇḍapātiko paṁsukūliko sapadānacāriko,
analyzed: acira upasampanno ca pana ayasmā sudinno evarūpe dhuta guṇe samādāya vattati āraññikaḥ hoti piṇḍapātiko pasukūliko sa padāna cāriko
translated: Soon after his full ordination, Sudinna took up the following ascetic practices: he was a wilderness dweller, an alms-goer, and a rag-robe wearer. He went for alms from door to door in a systematic manner,

original: aññataraṁ vajjigāmaṁ upanissāya viharati.
analyzed: aññataram vajjigāmam upanissāya viharati
translated: and he stayed in a certain village of the Vajjis.

original: Tena kho pana samayena vajjī dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena vajjī dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetu
translated: At that time the Vajjis were short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw. It was not easy to get by on almsfood.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa etadahosi—“etarahi kho vajjī dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa etat ahosi etarahi kho vajjī dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetu
translated: Sudinna thought, “The Vajjis are short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw. It’s not easy to get by on almsfood.

original: Bahū kho pana me vesāliyaṁ ñātī aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā pahūtajātarūparajatā pahūtavittūpakaraṇā pahūtadhanadhaññā.
analyzed: bahū kho pana me vesāliyam ñātī aḍḍhā mahat dhanā mahā bhogā pahūta jātarūpa rajatā pahūta vittu upakaraṇā pahūta dhana dhaññā
translated: But I have many relatives in Vesālī who are rich, with much money and property, with wealth to rival the gods.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ ñātī upanissāya vihareyyaṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham ñātī upanissāya vihareyya
translated: Why don’t I live supported by them?”

original: Ñātī maṁ nissāya dānāni dassanti puññāni karissanti, bhikkhū ca lābhaṁ lacchanti, ahañca piṇḍakena na kilamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: ñātī mam nissāya dānāni dassanti puññāni karissanti bhikkhū ca lābham lacchanti aham ca piṇḍakena na kilamissāmi iti
translated: ‘If I do, my relatives will make offerings and merit on my behalf, the monks will get a share of the food, and I won’t have to go begging.’

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno senāsanaṁ saṁsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena vesālī tena pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudinnaḥ senāsanam sasāmetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena vesālī tena pakkāmi
translated: He then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Vesālī.

original: Anupubbena yena vesālī tadavasari. Tatra sudaṁ āyasmā sudinno vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.🔽Assosuṁ kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātakā—“sudinno kira kalandaputto vesāliṁ anuppatto”ti. Te āyasmato sudinnassa saṭṭhimatte thālipāke bhattābhihāraṁ abhihariṁsu.
analyzed: anupubbena yena vesālī tat avasari tatra sudam āyasmā sudinnaḥ vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya  assosum kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātaka asudinno kira kalanda putto vesālim anuppatto ti te āyasmataḥ sudinnassa saṭṭhimatte thālipāke bhatta abhihāram abhiharisu
translated: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.🔽His relatives heard that he had arrived, and they brought him sixty servings of food.

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno te saṭṭhimatte thālipāke bhikkhūnaṁ vissajjetvā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kalandagāmaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudinnaḥ te saṭṭhimatte thālipāke bhikkhūnam vissajjetvā pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya kalandagāmam piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Sudinna gave those to the monks and then, in the morning, he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kalanda village for alms.

original: Kalandagāme sapadānaṁ piṇḍāya caramāno yena sakapitu nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: kalanda gāme piṇḍāya caramānaḥ yena sa kapitu nivesanam tena upasaṅkami
translated: As he was walking on continuous almsround, he came to his own father’s house.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sudinnassa ñātidāsī ābhidosikaṁ kummāsaṁ chaḍḍetukāmā hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ sudinnassa ñāti dāsī ābhidosikam kummāsam chaḍḍetu kāmā hoti
translated: On one occasion a female slave of Sudinna’s relatives wanted to throw away some leftover porridge.

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno taṁ ñātidāsiṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā sudinnaḥ tam ñāti dāsim etat avoca
translated: Sudinna said to her,

original: “sace taṁ, bhagini, chaḍḍanīyadhammaṁ, idha me patte ākirā”ti.
analyzed: sace bhagini chaḍḍanīya dhammaḥ idha me patte ākirāti
translated: “If it’s to be thrown away, put it in my bowl.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātidāsī taṁ ābhidosikaṁ kummāsaṁ āyasmato sudinnassa patte ākirantī hatthānañca pādānañca sarassa ca nimittaṁ aggahesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñāti dāsī tam ābhidosikam kummāsam āyasmato sudinnassa patte ākirantī hatthānam ca pādānam ca sarassa ca nimittam aggahesi
translated: As she was putting the porridge in his bowl, she noticed the signs of his hands, feet, and nails.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ñātidāsī yenāyasmato sudinnassa mātā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmato sudinnassa mātaraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa ñāti dāsī yena āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātaram etat avoca
translated: She then went to Sudinna’s mother and said,

original: “yaggheyye, jāneyyāsi,
analyzed: yaggheyye jāneyyā asi
translated: “Please know, madam,

original: ayyaputto sudinno anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: ayya putto sudinnaḥ anuppatto ti
translated: that Sudinna has returned.”

original: “Sace, je, tvaṁ saccaṁ bhaṇasi, adāsiṁ taṁ karomī”ti.
analyzed: sace je tvam saccam bhaṇasi adāsim tam karomi iti
translated: “If what you say is true, I’ll set you free.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sudinno taṁ ābhidosikaṁ kummāsaṁ aññataraṁ kuṭṭamūlaṁ nissāya paribhuñjati.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sudinnaḥ tam ābhidosikam kummāsam aññataram kuṭṭa mūlam nissāya paribhuñjati
translated: Sudinna was eating the porridge at the foot of a wall.

original: Pitāpi kho āyasmato sudinnassa kammantā āgacchanto addasa āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ taṁ ābhidosikaṁ kummāsaṁ aññataraṁ kuṭṭamūlaṁ nissāya paribhuñjantaṁ.
analyzed: pitā api kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa kammantāḥ āgacchantaḥ addase āyasmantam sudinnam tam ābhidosikam kummāsam aññataram kuṭṭa mūlam nissāya paribhuñjanta
translated: His father, who was coming from work, saw him.

original: Disvāna yenāyasmā sudinno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: disvāna yena āyasmā sudinno tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: He went up to Sudinna and said,

original: “atthi nāma, tāta sudinna, ābhidosikaṁ kummāsaṁ paribhuñjissasi.
analyzed: atthi nāma tāta sudinnaḥ ābhidosikam kummāsam paribhuñjissasi
translated: “So, Sudinna, you’re eating this porridge?

original: Nanu nāma, tāta sudinna, sakaṁ gehaṁ gantabban”ti?
analyzed: nanu nāma tāta sudinna sakam geham gantabbanti
translated: Why don’t you go to your own house?”

original: “Agamimha kho te, gahapati, gehaṁ.
analyzed: agamimha khalu te gahapati geha
translated: “We’ve been to your house, householder.

original: Tatāyaṁ ābhidosiko kummāso”ti.
analyzed: tata ayam ābhidosiko
translated: This is the porridge.”🔽Sudinna’s father then took hold of his arm and said,

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmato sudinnassa bāhāyaṁ gahetvā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca— “ehi, tāta sudinna, gharaṁ gamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pitā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa bāhāyam gahetvā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca ehi tāta sudinna gharam gamissāma ati
translated: “Come, Sudinna, let’s go home.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno yena sakapitu nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudinnaḥ yena sa kapitu nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: Sudinna went to his father’s house and sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca— “bhuñja, tāta sudinnā”ti.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pitā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca bhuñja tāta sudinna ati
translated: His father said to him, “Eat, Sudinna.”

original: “Alaṁ, gahapati, kataṁ me ajja bhattakiccan”ti.
analyzed: ala gahapati katam me ajja bhatta kiccanti
translated: “There’s no need, householder. I’ve already eaten today.”

original: “Adhivāsehi, tāta sudinna, svātanāya bhattan”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsehi tāta sudinna svātanāya
translated: “Then please accept a meal from me tomorrow.”

original: Adhivāsesi kho āyasmā sudinno tuṇhībhāvena. Atha kho āyasmā sudinno uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: adhivāsesi kho āyasmā sudinno tuṇhībhāvena atha kho āyasmā sudinno uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Sudinna consented by remaining silent. He then got up and left.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā tassā rattiyā accayena haritena gomayena pathaviṁ opuñjāpetvā dve puñje kārāpesi—ekaṁ hiraññassa, ekaṁ suvaṇṇassa.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena haritena gomayena pathavim opuñjāpetvā dve puñje kārāpesi ekam hiraññassa ekam suvaṇṇassa
translated: The following morning Sudinna’s mother had the ground smeared with fresh cow dung and had two heaps made, one of gold and one of silver.

original: Tāva mahantā puñjā ahesuṁ, orato ṭhito puriso pārato ṭhitaṁ purisaṁ na passati; pārato ṭhito puriso orato ṭhitaṁ purisaṁ na passati.
analyzed: tāva mahantā puñjā ahesu oratas ṭhitaḥ puriso pāratas ṭhitam purisam na passati pāratas ṭhitaḥ puriso oratas ṭhitam purisam na passati
translated: The heaps were so big that a man standing on one side couldn’t see a man on the other side.

original: Te puñje kilañjehi paṭicchādāpetvā majjhe āsanaṁ paññāpetvā tirokaraṇīyaṁ parikkhipitvā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: te puñje kilañjehi paṭicchādāpetvā majjhe āsanam paññāpetvā tirokaraṇīyam parikkhipitvā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikam āmantesi
translated: They covered the piles with straw and had a seat prepared in the middle. They then surrounded it with a curtain and said to Sudinna’s ex-wife,

original: “tena hi, vadhu, yena alaṅkārena alaṅkatā puttassa me sudinnassa piyā ahosi manāpā tena alaṅkārena alaṅkarā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi vadhu yena alaṅkārena alaṅkatā puttassa me sudinnassa piyā ahosi manāpā tena alaṅkārena alaṅkarāti
translated: “Well then, daughter-in-law, please adorn yourself with the jewelry that Sudinna liked so much.”

original: “Evaṁ, ayye”ti, kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi.🔽Atha kho āyasmā sudinno pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sakapitu nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: eva ayya iti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi  atha kho āyasmā sudinnaḥ pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena sa ka pitu nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: “Yes, mother,” she replied.🔽Then, when it was morning, Sudinna robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to his parents’ house. He sat down on the prepared seat

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā yenāyasmā sudinno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te puñje vivarāpetvā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pitā yena āyasmā sudinnaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te puñje vivarāpetvā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: His father had the piles uncovered and said to Sudinna,

original: “idaṁ te, tāta sudinna, mātu mattikaṁ itthikāya itthidhanaṁ, aññaṁ pettikaṁ aññaṁ pitāmahaṁ.🔽Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṁ puññāni ca kātuṁ.
analyzed: idam te tāta sudinna mātu mattikam itthikāya itthi dhana aññam pettikam aññam pitāmaha  labbhā tāta sudinna bhogā ca bhuñjitum puññāni ca kātu
translated: ‘Father, this is your mother’s clay, a woman’s wealth, something else for your father, and something else for your grandfather.🔽You can give up the monastic life and enjoy wealth and make merit.

original: Ehi tvaṁ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
analyzed: ehi tva tāta sudinna hīnāya avattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohi iti
translated: Come on, Sudinna, give up the monastic life and enjoy wealth and make merit.’

original: “Tāta, na ussahāmi na visahāmi, abhirato ahaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carāmī”ti.
analyzed: tāta na ussahāmi na visahāmi abhirataḥ aham brahmacariyam carāmi iti
translated: ‘Father, I can’t. I’m not able to. I’m happy with the spiritual life.’

original: Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pitā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: and a third time Sudinna’s father said to him,

original: “idaṁ te, tāta sudinna, mātu mattikaṁ, itthikāya itthidhanaṁ, aññaṁ pettikaṁ, aññaṁ pitāmahaṁ.🔽Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṁ puññāni ca kātuṁ.
analyzed: idam te tāta sudinna mātu mattike itthikāya itthi dhana aññam pettika aññam pitāmaha  labbhā tāta sudinna bhogā ca bhuñjitum puññāni ca kātu
translated: ‘Father, this is your mother’s clay, a woman’s wealth, something else for your father, and something else for your grandfather.🔽You can give up the monastic life and enjoy wealth and make merit.

original: Ehi tvaṁ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
analyzed: ehi tva tāta sudinna hīnāya avattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohi iti
translated: Come on, Sudinna, give up the monastic life and enjoy wealth and make merit.’

original: “Vadeyyāma kho taṁ, gahapati, sace tvaṁ nātikaḍḍheyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: vadeyyāma khalu ta gahapati sace tvam na atikaḍḍheyyāsi iti
translated: “If you don’t press me, I’ll tell you.”

original: “Vadehi, tāta sudinnā”ti.
analyzed: vadehi tāta sudinna iti
translated: “Tell me, dear Sudinna.”

original: “Tena hi tvaṁ, gahapati, mahante mahante sāṇipasibbake kārāpetvā hiraññasuvaṇṇassa pūrāpetvā sakaṭehi nibbāhāpetvā majjhe gaṅgāya sote opātehi.
analyzed: tena hi tva gahapati mahante mahante sāṇi pasibbake kārāpetvā hirañña suvaṇṇassa pūrāpetvā sakaṭehi nibbāhāpetvā majjhe gaṅgāya sote opātehi
translated: “Well then, householder, have large sacks made, fill them with gold coins and gold bullion, have them carried to the middle of the Ganges, and dump them there.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Yañhi te, gahapati, bhavissati tatonidānaṁ bhayaṁ vā chambhitattaṁ vā lomahaṁso vā ārakkho vā so te na bhavissatī”ti.🔽Evaṁ vutte, āyasmato sudinnassa pitā anattamano ahosi— “kathañhi nāma putto sudinno evaṁ vakkhatī”ti.
analyzed: yat hi te gahapati bhavissati tatonidānam bhayam vā chambhitattam vā loma hasaḥ vā ārakkhaḥ vā saḥ te na bhavissati iti  evam vutte āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pitā anattamanaḥ ahosi katham hi nāma putto sudinno evam vakkhati iti
translated: Whatever fear, terror, or horror you might have will be no more.”🔽When this was said, Sudinna’s father was displeased, “How can my son Sudinna say this?”

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa pitā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pitā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikam āmantesi
translated: He then said to Sudinna’s ex-wife,

original: “tena hi, vadhu, tvaṁ piyā ca manāpā ca. Appeva nāma putto sudinno tuyhampi vacanaṁ kareyyā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi vadhu tvam piyā ca manāpā ca appā iva nāma putto su dinnaḥ tuyham pi vacanam kareyya ati
translated: “Well then, wife, be dear and pleasant to Sudinna. Perhaps he’ll listen to you.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa pādesu gahetvā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa pādesu gahetvā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: Then Sudinna’s ex-wife grabbed his feet and said,

original: “kīdisā nāma tā, ayyaputta, accharāyo yāsaṁ tvaṁ hetu brahmacariyaṁ carasī”ti?
analyzed: kīdisāḥ nāma tāḥ ayya putta accharāyaḥ yāsam tvam hetu brahmacariyam carasi iti
translated: “What are these goddesses like, dear Sudinna, for whose sake you lead the spiritual life?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, bhagini, accharānaṁ hetu brahmacariyaṁ carāmī”ti.
analyzed: na kho aha bhagini accharānam brahmacariyam carāmi iti
translated: “Sister, I don’t lead the spiritual life for the sake of goddesses.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā— “ajjatagge maṁ ayyaputto sudinno bhaginivādena samudācaratī”ti, tattheva mucchitā papatā.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā ajjatagge mam ayya putto sudinnaḥ bhagini vādena samudācarati iti tattha iva mucchitā papatā
translated: Then, thinking, “From this day forward, Sudinna addresses me as ‘sister,’” she fainted right there and fell to the ground.

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno pitaraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā sudinnaḥ pitaram etat avoca
translated: Sudinna said to his father,

original: “sace, gahapati, bhojanaṁ dātabbaṁ detha,
analyzed: sace gahapati bhojanam dātabbam detha
translated: “If you’re going to give a meal, then give it.

original: mā no viheṭhayitthā”ti.
analyzed: mā naḥ viheṭhayittha ati
translated: But don’t harass us.”

original: “Bhuñja, tāta sudinnā”ti.
analyzed: bhuñja tāta sudinna ati
translated: “Eat, dear Sudinna.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā ca pitā ca āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesuṁ sampavāresuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā ca pitā ca āyasmantam sudinnam paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesum sampavāresu
translated: Then Sudinna’s mother and father personally served and satisfied Sudinna with exquisite staple and non-staple food.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā āyasmantam sudinnam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim etat avoca
translated: When Sudinna’s mother saw that he had finished his meal and had put away his bowl, she said to him,

original: “idaṁ, tāta sudinna, kulaṁ aḍḍhaṁ mahaddhanaṁ mahābhogaṁ pahūtajātarūparajataṁ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṁ pahūtadhanadhaññaṁ.🔽Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṁ puññāni ca kātuṁ.
analyzed: idam tāta sudinna kulam aḍḍham mahat dhanam mahā bhogam pahūta jātarūpa rajatam pahūta vittu upakaraṇam pahūta dhana dhañña  labbhā tāta sudinna bhogā ca bhuñjitum puññāni ca kātu
translated: “Dear Sudinna, this family is rich, with great wealth and property, with many thousands of gold coins and silver, with much money, grain, and bullion.🔽It’s possible for you to enjoy wealth and make merit by returning to a lower form of life.

original: Ehi tvaṁ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
analyzed: ehi tva tāta sudinna hīnāya avattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohi iti
translated: Come, dear Sudinna, return to a lower form of life and enjoy wealth and make merit.”

original: “Amma, na ussahāmi na visahāmi, abhirato ahaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carāmī”ti.
analyzed: amma naḥ ussahāmi na visahāmi abhirataḥ aham brahmacariyam carāmi iti
translated: “Mother, I’m not able to. I’m not willing to. I’m contented with the spiritual life.”

original: Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: and a third time Sudinna’s mother said to him,

original: “idaṁ, tāta sudinna, kulaṁ aḍḍhaṁ mahaddhanaṁ mahābhogaṁ pahūtajātarūparajataṁ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṁ pahūtadhanadhaññaṁ.
analyzed: idam tāta sudinna kulam aḍḍham mahat dhanam mahā bhogam pahūta jātarūpa rajatam pahūta vittu upakaraṇam pahūta dhana dhañña
translated: “Dear Sudinna, this family is rich, with great wealth and property, with many thousands of gold coins and silver, with much money, grain, and bullion.

original: Tena hi, tāta sudinna, bījakampi dehi—
analyzed: tena hi tāta sudinna bījakampi dehi
translated: Well then, dear Sudinna, give some of the seed.

original: mā no aputtakaṁ sāpateyyaṁ licchavayo atiharāpesun”ti.
analyzed: mā naḥ aputtakam sāpateyyam licchavayaḥ
translated: Don’t let the Licchavīs take our property because we have no son.”

original: “Etaṁ kho me, amma, sakkā kātun”ti.
analyzed: etam khalu me amma sakkā kātunti
translated: “I can do that, Mother.”

original: “Kahaṁ pana, tāta sudinna, etarahi viharasī”ti?
analyzed: kaham pana tāta sudinnaḥ etarahi viharasi iti
translated: “But where are you staying at present?”

original: “Mahāvane, ammā”ti.
analyzed: mahā vane ammā ati
translated: “In the Great Wood.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudinno uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudinnaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Sudinna got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikam āmantesi
translated: Soon afterwards Sudinna’s mother told his ex-wife,

original: “tena hi, vadhu, yadā utunī ahosi, pupphaṁ te uppannaṁ hoti, atha me āroceyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi vadhu yadā utunī ahosi puppham te uppannam hoti atha me āroceyyāsi iti
translated: “When you’re fertile and you conceive a child, please let me know.”

original: “Evaṁ, ayye”ti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi.
analyzed: eva ayya iti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi
translated: “Yes, madam,” she replied.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā nacirasseva utunī ahosi, pupphaṁsā uppajji.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā nacirassa iva utunī ahosi puppha sā uppajji
translated: Soon afterwards she became fertile and conceived a child.🔽She then told Sudinna’s mother,

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātaraṁ etadavoca—“utunīmhi, ayye, pupphaṁ me uppannan”ti.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātaram etat avoca otunīmhi ayye puppham me uppannanti
translated: “Madam, I’m fertile and I’ve conceived a child.”

original: “Tena hi, vadhu, yena alaṅkārena alaṅkatā puttassa sudinnassa piyā ahosi manāpā tena alaṅkārena alaṅkarā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi vadhu yena alaṅkārena alaṅkatā puttassa sudinnassa piyā ahosi manāpā tena alaṅkārena alaṅkarāti
translated: “Well then, wife, please adorn yourself with the jewelry that you used to adorn yourself with when you were Sudinna’s wife.”

original: “Evaṁ, ayye”ti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi.
analyzed: eva ayya iti kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā āyasmato sudinnassa mātuyā paccassosi
translated: “Yes, Venerable,” she replied.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikaṁ ādāya yena mahāvanaṁ yenāyasmā sudinno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikam ādāya yena mahā vanam yena āyasmā sudinnaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: Then Sudinna’s mother took his ex-wife with her to the Great Wood, to Sudinna, and said to him,

original: “idaṁ, tāta sudinna, kulaṁ aḍḍhaṁ mahaddhanaṁ mahābhogaṁ pahūtajātarūparajataṁ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṁ pahūtadhanadhaññaṁ.🔽Labbhā, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhogā ca bhuñjituṁ puññāni ca kātuṁ.
analyzed: idam tāta sudinna kulam aḍḍham mahat dhanam mahā bhogam pahūta jātarūpa rajatam pahūta vittu upakaraṇam pahūta dhana dhañña  labbhā tāta sudinna bhogā ca bhuñjitum puññāni ca kātu
translated: “Dear Sudinna, this family is rich, with great wealth and property, with abundant gold and silver, with abundant possessions and grain.🔽It’s possible to enjoy oneself and do good deeds.

original: Ehi tvaṁ, tāta sudinna, hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohī”ti.
analyzed: ehi tva tāta sudinna hīnāya avattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjassu puññāni ca karohi iti
translated: Come, dear Sudinna, return to the lower life and enjoy yourself and do good deeds.”

original: “Amma, na ussahāmi na visahāmi,
analyzed: amma na ussahāmi na visahāmi
translated: “Mother, I’m not able to.”

original: abhirato ahaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carāmī”ti.🔽Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: abhirataḥ aham brahmacariyam carāmi iti  dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: I’m happy and I’m confident in my practice.”

original: tatiyampi kho āyasmato sudinnassa mātā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa mātā āyasmantam sudinnam etat avoca
translated: A second and a third time Sudinna’s mother said,

original: “idaṁ, tāta sudinna, kulaṁ aḍḍhaṁ mahaddhanaṁ mahābhogaṁ pahūtajātarūparajataṁ pahūtavittūpakaraṇaṁ pahūtadhanadhaññaṁ.
analyzed: idam tāta sudinna kulam aḍḍham mahat dhanam mahā bhogam pahūta jātarūpa rajatam pahūta vittu upakaraṇam pahūta dhana dhañña
translated: “Sudinna, this family is wealthy.

original: Tena hi, tāta sudinna, bījakampi dehi—
analyzed: tena hi tāta sudinna bījakampi dehi
translated: So give us a son,

original: mā no aputtakaṁ sāpateyyaṁ licchavayo atiharāpesun”ti.
analyzed: mā naḥ aputtakam sāpateyyam licchavayaḥ
translated: so that the Licchavīs don’t take our property because we have no son.”

original: “Etaṁ kho me, amma, sakkā kātun”ti,
analyzed: etam khalu me amma sakkā kātunti
translated: “I can do that, Mother.”

original: purāṇadutiyikāya bāhāyaṁ gahetvā mahāvanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā apaññatte sikkhāpade anādīnavadasso purāṇadutiyikāya tikkhattuṁ methunaṁ dhammaṁ abhiviññāpesi.
analyzed: purāṇa dutiyikāya bāhāyam gahetvā mahā vanam ajjhogāhetvā a paññatte sikkhāpade anādīnava dasso purāṇa dutiyikāya tikkhattum methunam dhammam abhiviññāpesi
translated: He then took his ex-wife by the arm, went to the Great Wood, and had sexual intercourse with her three times, not seeing the danger in it.

original: Sā tena gabbhaṁ gaṇhi.
analyzed: sā tena gabbham gaṇhi
translated: She became pregnant.

original: Bhummā devā saddamanussāvesuṁ—
analyzed: bhummā devā sadda manussāvesu
translated: The gods of the earth announced,

original: “nirabbudo vata bho bhikkhusaṅgho nirādīnavo;
analyzed: nirabbudaḥ vata bho bhikkhu saṅghaḥ nirādīnavaḥ
translated: “The Sangha of monks is free from abscesses and dangers.

original: sudinnena kalandaputtena abbudaṁ uppāditaṁ, ādīnavo uppādito”ti.
analyzed: sudinnena kalanda puttena abbudam uppāditaḥ ādīnavaḥ uppāditaḥ ti
translated: But Sudinna, the son of Kalanda, has created an abscess and a danger.”

original: Bhummānaṁ devānaṁ saddaṁ sutvā cātumahārājikā devā saddamanussāvesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: bhummānam devānam saddam sutvā cātumahārājikāḥ devā saddam anussāvesum pe
translated: The gods of the four divine kings heard the gods of the Thirty-three …

original: tāvatiṁsā devā …
analyzed: devā
translated: The gods of the Thirty-three …

original: yāmā devā …🔽tusitā devā …🔽nimmānaratī devā …
analyzed: yāmā devā  tusitā devā  nimmāna ratī devā
translated: The Yāma gods …🔽The gods who delight in creation …

original: paranimmitavasavattī devā …
analyzed: devā
translated: The gods who control the creation of others …

original: brahmakāyikā devā saddamanussāvesuṁ—
analyzed: brahmakāyikāḥ devā sadda manussāvesu
translated: The gods of the realm of the supreme beings proclaimed:

original: “nirabbudo vata bho bhikkhusaṅgho nirādīnavo;
analyzed: nirabbudaḥ vata bho bhikkhu saṅghaḥ nirādīnavaḥ
translated: “The Sangha of monks is free from boils and abscesses.

original: sudinnena kalandaputtena abbudaṁ uppāditaṁ, ādīnavo uppādito”ti.
analyzed: sudinnena kalanda puttena abbudam uppāditaḥ ādīnavaḥ uppāditaḥ ti
translated: Sudinna has created a boil and an abscess.”

original: Itiha tena khaṇena tena muhuttena yāva brahmalokā saddo abbhuggacchi.🔽Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikā tassa gabbhassa paripākamanvāya puttaṁ vijāyi.
analyzed: iti ha tena khaṇena tena muhuttena yāva brahmalokā saddaḥ abbhuggacchi  atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikā tassa gabbhassa paripākam anvāya puttam vijāyi
translated: And in that moment, in that second, the news spread as far as the world of the supreme beings.🔽Soon after giving birth, Sudinna’s ex-wife gave birth to a son.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa sahāyakā tassa dārakassa bījakoti nāmaṁ akaṁsu.🔽Āyasmato sudinnassa purāṇadutiyikāya bījakamātāti nāmaṁ akaṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa sahāyakā tassa dārakassa bījakā iti nāmam akasu  ā yasmataḥ sudinnassa purāṇa dutiyikāya bījaka mātā ati nāmaṃ akasu
translated: Sudinna’s friends gave the boy the name Bījako.🔽They gave the boy’s mother the name Bījakamātā.

original: Āyasmato sudinnassa bījakapitāti nāmaṁ akaṁsu.
analyzed: ā yasmataḥ sudinnassa bījaka pitā ati nāmam akasu
translated: They gave the boy’s father the name Bījakapitā.

original: Te aparena samayena ubho agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitvā arahattaṁ sacchākaṁsu.
analyzed: te aparena samayena ubho agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitvā arahattam
translated: After some time they both went forth from the home life into homelessness, and they realized perfection.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa ahudeva kukkuccaṁ, ahu vippaṭisāro—🔽“alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṁ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṁ;
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa vippaṭisāraḥ  alābhāḥ vata me na vata me lābhāḥ dulladdham vata me na vata me su laddha
translated: Sudinna was then remorseful and anxious,

original: yohaṁ evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā nāsakkhiṁ yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ caritun”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ ham evam su ākkhāte dhamma vinaye pabbajitvā na asakkhim yāvajīvam paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam caritun ti
translated: “It’s no gain for me that I’ve gone forth on such a well-proclaimed spiritual path and yet I’m unable to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.”

original: So teneva kukkuccena tena vippaṭisārena kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto antomano līnamano dukkhī dummano vippaṭisārī pajjhāyi.
analyzed: so tena iva kukkuccena tena vippaṭisārena kisaḥ ahosi lūkhaḥ dubbaṇṇaḥ uppaṇḍu paṇḍuka jātaḥ dhamani santhata gattaḥ antomanaḥ līna manaḥ dukkhī dummanaḥ vippaṭisārī pajjhāyi
translated: Because of that remorse and anxiety, he became thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over his body. He was depressed, unhappy, and full of regret.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sudinnassa sahāyakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ sudinnassa sahāyakāḥ bhikkhū āyasmantam sudinnam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then the monks who were Sudinna’s friends said to him,

original: “pubbe kho tvaṁ, āvuso sudinna, vaṇṇavā ahosi pīṇindriyo pasannamukhavaṇṇo vippasannachavivaṇṇo;
analyzed: pubbe kho tva āvuso sudinna vaṇṇavā ahosi pīṇi indriyaḥ pasanna mukha vaṇṇaḥ vippasanna chavi vaṇṇaḥ
translated: “Previously, Sudinna, you were radiant, with a clear and bright complexion.

original: so dāni tvaṁ etarahi kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto antomano līnamano dukkhī dummano vippaṭisārī pajjhāyasi.
analyzed: saḥ dāni tvam etarahi kisaḥ lūkhaḥ dubbaṇṇaḥ uppaṇḍu paṇḍuka jātaḥ dhamani santhata gattaḥ antomanaḥ līna manaḥ dukkhī dummanaḥ vippaṭisārī pajjhāyasi
translated: You’re now thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over your body. You’re depressed and mentally suffering, and you’re regretting your actions.

original: Kacci no tvaṁ, āvuso sudinna, anabhirato brahmacariyaṁ carasī”ti?
analyzed: kacci no tvam āvuso sudinna an abhirataḥ brahmacariyam carasi iti
translated: Have you lost your desire for the spiritual life?”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, anabhirato brahmacariyaṁ carāmi.
analyzed: na kho aha āvuso an abhirataḥ brahmacariyam carāmi
translated: “I haven’t lost my desire for the spiritual life.

original: Atthi me pāpakammaṁ kataṁ;
analyzed: atthi me pāpa kammam kata
translated: I’ve done a bad thing.

original: purāṇadutiyikāya methuno dhammo paṭisevito;
analyzed: purāṇa dutiyikāya methuno dhammo paṭisevito
translated: I’ve had sexual intercourse with my ex-wife.

original: tassa mayhaṁ, āvuso, ahudeva kukkuccaṁ ahu vippaṭisāro—
analyzed: tassa mayhaḥ āvuso ahu deva kukkuccam ahu vippaṭisāraḥ
translated: I’ve been anxious and remorseful,

original: ‘alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṁ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṁ; yohaṁ
analyzed: alābhāḥ vata me na vata me lābhāḥ dulladdham vata me na vata me
translated: thinking, ‘It’s a loss for me, it’s not a gain. I’ve failed, not succeeded,

original: evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā nāsakkhiṁ yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ
analyzed: evam su ākkhāte dhamma vinaye pabbajitvā na asakkhim yāvajīvam paripuṇṇam parisuddha
translated: that I, having gone forth in such a well-proclaimed spiritual path and practice,

original: brahmacariyaṁ caritun’”ti.
analyzed: brahmacariyam caritum ti
translated: was unable to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life all my life.’”

original: “Alañhi te, āvuso sudinna, kukkuccāya alaṁ vippaṭisārāya yaṁ tvaṁ evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.🔽Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito, no sarāgāya;
analyzed: alam hi te āvuso sudinna kukkuccāya alam vippaṭisārāya yam tvam evam su ākkhāte dhamma vinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvam paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam caritu  nanu āvuso bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desitaḥ no sa rāgāya
translated: “It’s no surprise that you should be anxious and remorseful, Sudinna, since you have gone forth in such a well-taught Dhamma and Discipline, yet are unable to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end of your life.🔽Haven’t the qualities of dispassion been taught by the Buddha in many ways?

original: visaṁyogāya dhammo desito, no saṁyogāya;
analyzed: visayogāya dhammaḥ desitaḥ no sayogāya
translated: Haven’t the qualities of being unfettered been taught by the Buddha in many ways?

original: anupādānāya dhammo desito, no saupādānāya.🔽Tattha nāma tvaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā virāgāya dhamme desite sarāgāya cetessasi, visaṁyogāya dhamme desite saṁyogāya cetessasi, anupādānāya dhamme desite saupādānāya cetessasi.🔽Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena rāgavirāgāya dhammo desito,
analyzed: anupādānāya dhammo desito no sa aupādānāya  tattha nāma tvaṃ āvuso bhagavatā virāgāya dhamme desite sa rāgāya cetessasi visayogāya dhamme desite sa yogāya cetessasi anupādānāya dhamme desite sa upādānāya cetessasi  nanu āvuso bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena rāga virāgāya dhammo desito
translated: Haven’t the qualities of non-grasping been taught by the Buddha in many ways?🔽So how can you, having gone forth in such a well-taught Dhamma and Discipline, want to practice with passion, fetters, and grasping?🔽Haven’t the qualities of dispassion for sensual pleasures been taught by the Buddha in many ways?

original: madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭupacchedāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito.
analyzed: mada nimmadanāya pipāsa vinayāya ālaya samugghātāya vaṭṭa upacchedāya taṇhā kkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammaḥ desito
translated: Haven’t the qualities of the subsiding of vanity, the removal of thirst, the uprooting of attachment, the ending of the round of rebirths, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, and extinguishment been taught by the Buddha in many ways?

original: Nanu, āvuso, bhagavatā anekapariyāyena kāmānaṁ pahānaṁ akkhātaṁ,
analyzed: nanu āvuso bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena kāmānam pahānam akkhāta
translated: Haven’t the many kinds of abandoning of sensual pleasures been taught by the Buddha?

original: kāmasaññānaṁ pariññā akkhātā,🔽kāmapipāsānaṁ paṭivinayo akkhāto,
analyzed: kāma saññānam pariññā akkhātā  kāma pipāsānam paṭivinayaḥ akkhāto
translated: Haven’t the many kinds of full understanding of sensual perceptions been taught?🔽Haven’t the many kinds of overcoming of the craving for sensual pleasures been taught?

original: kāmavitakkānaṁ samugghāto akkhāto,
analyzed: kāma vitakkānam samugghātaḥ akkhātaḥ
translated: Haven’t the many kinds of uprooting of thoughts of sensual desire been taught?

original: kāmapariḷāhānaṁ vūpasamo akkhāto.🔽Netaṁ, āvuso, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṁ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.
analyzed: kāma pariḷāhānam vūpasamaḥ akkhāto  na itas āvuso appasannānam vā pasādāya pasannānam vā bhiyyobhāvāya
translated: Haven’t the many kinds of stilling of the fevers of sensual desire been taught?🔽This will neither inspire confidence in the unconvinced nor increase the faithful.

original: Atha khvetaṁ, āvuso, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṁ aññathattāyā”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha khvete āvuso appasannānam ca iva appasādāya pasannānam ca ekaccānam aññathattāya ati  atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantam sudinnam aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: But it will cause some of the faithful to lose their faith.”🔽After rebuking Sudinna in many ways, they told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā āyasmantam sudinnam paṭipucchi
translated: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Sudinna:

original: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, sudinna, purāṇadutiyikāya methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭisevī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira sudinna purāṇa dutiyikāya methunam dhammam paṭisevi iti
translated: “Is it true, Sudinna, that you’ve had sexual intercourse with your ex-wife?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Buddha rebuked him …

original: “ananucchavikaṁ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṁ appaṭirūpaṁ assāmaṇakaṁ akappiyaṁ akaraṇīyaṁ.
analyzed: ananucchavika moghapurisa ananulomikam appaṭirūpam a sāmaṇakam a kappiyam a karaṇīya
translated: “Foolish man, it’s unseemly, improper, unsuitable, unworthy of a monastic, and not to be done.

original: Kathañhi nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvaṁ paripuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: katham hi nāma tva mogha purisa evam su ākkhāte dhamma vinaye pabbajitvā na sakkhissasi yāvajīvam paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam caritu
translated: How can you, after going forth in such a well-proclaimed spiritual path and discipline, not be able to practice the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life to the end of your life?

original: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito, no sarāgāya;
analyzed: nanu mayā moghapurisa aneka pariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito no sa rāgāya
translated: Foolish man, haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion;

original: visaṁyogāya dhammo desito, no saṁyogāya;
analyzed: visayogāya dhammaḥ desitaḥ no sayogāya
translated: for freedom from bondage, not for the sake of bondage;

original: anupādānāya dhammo desito, no saupādānāya.
analyzed: anupādānāya dhammo desito no sa aupādānāya
translated: for the sake of non-grasping, not for the sake of grasping?

original: Tattha nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, mayā virāgāya dhamme desite sarāgāya cetessasi, visaṁyogāya dhamme desite saṁyogāya cetessasi, anupādānāya dhamme desite saupādānāya cetessasi.
analyzed: tattha nāma tva mogha purisa mayā virāgāya dhamme desite sa rāgāya cetessasi visayogāya dhamme desite sa yogāya cetessasi anupādānāya dhamme desite sa upādānāya cetessasi
translated: And yet, foolish man, you, after my teaching the Teaching for the sake of dispassion, want to indulge in passion; after my teaching the Teaching for freedom from bondage, you want to indulge in bondage; after my teaching the Teaching for the sake of non-grasping, you want to indulge in grasping.

original: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena rāgavirāgāya dhammo desito.
analyzed: nanu mayā moghapurisa aneka pariyāyena rāga virāgāya dhammo desito
translated: Foolish man, haven’t I given many teachings for the fading away of passion?

original: Madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭupacchedāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito.
analyzed: mada nimmadanāya pipāsa vinayāya ālaya samugghātāya vaṭṭa upacchedāya taṇhā kkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammaḥ desito
translated: for the removal of passion, for the removal of hatred, for the removal of delusion, for the destruction of craving, for the destruction of attachment, for the destruction of the underlying tendencies, for the eradication of the pollutants, for the destruction of conceit, for the stilling of the entanglement in fevers, for the realization of the fruit of true knowledge and liberation, for the realization of the supreme state of sublime peace.

original: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena kāmānaṁ pahānaṁ akkhātaṁ,
analyzed: nanu mayā moghapurisa aneka pariyāyena kāmānam pahānam akkhāta
translated: Haven’t I given many teachings for the abandoning of sensual pleasures,

original: kāmasaññānaṁ pariññā akkhātā,🔽kāmapipāsānaṁ paṭivinayo akkhāto,
analyzed: kāma saññānam pariññā akkhātā  kāma pipāsānam paṭivinayaḥ akkhāto
translated: for the full understanding of sensual perceptions,🔽for the removal of sensual craving,

original: kāmavitakkānaṁ samugghāto akkhāto,
analyzed: kāma vitakkānam samugghātaḥ akkhātaḥ
translated: for the uprooting of thoughts of sensual desire,

original: kāmapariḷāhānaṁ vūpasamo akkhāto.🔽Varaṁ te, moghapurisa, āsivisassa ghoravisassa mukhe aṅgajātaṁ pakkhittaṁ, na tveva mātugāmassa aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṁ pakkhittaṁ.
analyzed: kāma pariḷāhānam vūpasamaḥ akkhāto  varam te mogha purisa āsi visassa ghora visassa mukhe aṅga jātam pakkhitta na tu eva mātugāmassa aṅga jāte aṅga jātam pakkhitta
translated: for the stilling of fevers of sensual passion?🔽It would be better, foolish man, if you were to place your penis in the mouth of a poisonous snake than in the vulva of a woman.

original: Varaṁ te, moghapurisa, kaṇhasappassa mukhe aṅgajātaṁ pakkhittaṁ, na tveva mātugāmassa aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṁ pakkhittaṁ.
analyzed: varam te mogha purisa kaṇha sappassa mukhe aṅga jātam pakkhitta na tu eva mātugāmassa aṅga jāte aṅga jātam pakkhitta
translated: It would be better, foolish man, if you were to place your penis in the mouth of a black snake than in the vulva of a woman.

original: Varaṁ te, moghapurisa, aṅgārakāsuyā ādittāya sampajjalitāya sajotibhūtāya aṅgajātaṁ pakkhittaṁ, na tveva mātugāmassa aṅgajāte aṅgajātaṁ pakkhittaṁ.
analyzed: varam te mogha purisa aṅgārakāsuyāḥ ādittāya sampajjalitāya sajoti bhūtāya aṅga jātam pakkhitta na tu eva mātugāmassa aṅga jāte aṅga jātam pakkhitta
translated: It would be better, foolish man, for your penis to enter the mouth of a fiery furnace, burning, blazing, and glowing, than for it to enter a woman.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tatonidānañhi, moghapurisa, maraṇaṁ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṁ vā dukkhaṁ, na tveva tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya.🔽Itonidānañca kho, moghapurisa, kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya.
analyzed: tatonidānam hi mogha purisa maraṇam vā nigaccheyya maraṇa mattam vā dukkha na tu eva tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyya  itonidānam ca kho moghapurisa kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyya
translated: Because of that, you might die or suffer death-like suffering, but not because of that, on the dissolution of the body, after death, would you be reborn in a bad destination, a lower realm, a place of suffering, hell.🔽But because of that, foolish man, on the dissolution of the body, after death, you will be reborn in a bad destination, a lower realm, a place of suffering, hell.

original: Tattha nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, yaṁ tvaṁ asaddhammaṁ gāmadhammaṁ vasaladhammaṁ duṭṭhullaṁ odakantikaṁ rahassaṁ dvayaṁdvayasamāpattiṁ samāpajjissasi,
analyzed: tattha nāma tva mogha purisa yam tvam asat dhammam gāma dhammam vasala dhammam duṭṭhullam odaka ntikam rahassam dvaya dvaya samāpattim samāpajjissasi
translated: Why is that? Because of that, foolish man, you will enter into an unwholesome, unbeneficial, and painful situation.

original: bahūnaṁ kho tvaṁ, moghapurisa, akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ ādikattā pubbaṅgamo.
analyzed: bahūnam kho tva moghapurisa akusalānam dhammānam ādikattā pubbaṅgamaḥ
translated: You, foolish man, are the forerunner and leader of many unwholesome and unbeneficial things.

original: Netaṁ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṁ vā bhiyyobhāvāya;
analyzed: neta mogha purisa appasannānam vā pasādāya pasannānam vā bhiyyobhāvāya
translated: “Foolish man, this neither inspires faith in the faithless …”

original: atha khvetaṁ, moghapurisa, appasannānañceva appasādāya, pasannānañca ekaccānaṁ aññathattāyā”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ sudinnaṁ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya dupposatāya
analyzed: atha khveta moghapurisa appasannānam ca iva appasādāya pasannānam ca ekaccānam aññathattāya ati  atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam sudinnam aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbhara tāya dupposa tāya
translated: This neither inspires faith in the faithless …” …🔽“This causes the faith of some to decline …” …

original: mahicchatāya asantuṭṭhitāya saṅgaṇikāya kosajjassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsitvā anekapariyāyena
analyzed: mahicchatāya a santuṭṭhitāya saṅgaṇikāya kosajjassa avaṇṇam bhāsitvā aneka pariyāyena
translated: After rebuking him in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

original: subharatāya suposatāya appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa🔽apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsitvā
analyzed: subharatāya su posatāya appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa  apacayassa vīriya ārambhassa vaṇṇam bhāsitvā
translated: and spoke in praise of being content with anything at all …

original: bhikkhūnaṁ tadanucchavikaṁ tadanulomikaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: bhikkhūnam tad anucchavikam tad anulomikam dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: After that, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave bhikkhūnam sikkhāpadam paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca
translated: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the monks for ten reasons:

original: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṁ puggalānaṁ niggahāya, pesalānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ🔽phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ āsavānaṁ saṁvarāya, samparāyikānaṁ āsavānaṁ paṭighātāya,
analyzed: saṅgha suṭṭhu tāya saṅgha phāsu tāya dummaṅkūnam puggalānam niggahāya pesalānam bhikkhūnam  phāsu vihārāya diṭṭhadhammikānam āsavānam savarāya samparāyikānam āsavānam paṭighātāya

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—

analyzed: addasa kho sā makkaṭī te bhikkhū dūratas vas āgacchante  disvāna yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tesam bhikkhūnam puratas kaṭim pi cālesi cheppam pi cālesi kaṭim pi oḍḍi nimittam pi akāsi

translated: We are the ones who have missed out on the well-proclaimed Teaching and training, who have failed to practice the spiritual life perfectly and completely.

analyzed: idāni ce ipi bhante ānanda labheyyāma bhagavato santike pabbajjam labheyyāma  upasampadaḥ idāni pi mayam vipassakā kusalānam dhammānam pubbaratta apararattam

translated: “Yes, friends,” Ven. Ānanda responded to the Vajjians. He then went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, said to him, “Lord, the Vajjians have come to see the Blessed One. original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One, having given a Dhamma talk with regard to this cause, to this incident, addressed the monks:

original: “yo, bhikkhave, sikkhaṁ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṁ anāvikatvā methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭisevati so āgato na upasampādetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave sikkham a paccakkhāya dubbalyam an āvikatvā methunam dhammam paṭisevati saḥ āgataḥ na upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: “Monks, if anyone should engage in sexual intercourse—even with a female animal—he is not a contemplative, not one of the sons of the Sakyan. He is excluded from this Dhamma-&-Vinaya.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, sikkhaṁ paccakkhāya dubbalyaṁ āvikatvā methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭisevati so āgato upasampādetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave sikkham paccakkhāya dubbalyam āvikatvā methunam dhammam paṭisevati saḥ āgataḥ upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: “But if anyone, having renounced sensual pleasures, should engage in sexual intercourse—even with a female animal—he is a contemplative, a son of the Sakyan. He is not excluded from this Dhamma-&-Vinaya.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: “And, monks, this is how you should recite this training rule:🔽‘“If a monk should engage in sexual intercourse, even with a female animal, he is not a contemplative, not a son of the Sakyan. He is excluded from this Dhamma-&-Vinaya.’”

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṁ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṁ anāvikatvā methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāyapi, pārājiko hoti asaṁvāso”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnam sikkhā sājīva samāpannaḥ sikkham a paccakkhāya dubbalyam an āvikatvā methunam dhammam paṭiseveyya antamasaḥ pārājikaḥ hoti a sa vāsā iti
translated: ‘If a monk, having been accepted by monks as a monastic trainee, should have sexual intercourse—even with an animal—he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

original: Yo panāti
analyzed: yaḥ panāti
translated: If a monk:

original: yo yādiso yathāyutto yathājacco yathānāmo yathāgotto yathāsīlo yathāvihārī yathāgocaro thero vā navo vā majjhimo vā. Eso vuccati “yo panā”ti.🔽Bhikkhūti
analyzed: yaḥ yādisaḥ yathāyuttaḥ yathājaccaḥ yathānāmaḥ yathāgottaḥ yathāsīlaḥ yathāvihārī yathāgocaraḥ theraḥ vā navaḥ vā majjhimaḥ vā eso vuccati yaḥ pana ati  bhikkhū ti
translated: if a monk of such a kind, of such a name, of such a clan, of such a social class, of such a lifestyle, of such a behavior, of such a conduct, whether senior, junior, or of middle standing.🔽A monk:

original: bhikkhakoti bhikkhu,🔽bhikkhācariyaṁ ajjhupagatoti bhikkhu,
analyzed: bhikkhako ti bhikkhu  bhikkhācariyam ajjhupagataḥ ti bhikkhu
translated: he begs (bhikkha), thus he is a monk (bhikkhu);🔽he has undertaken the proper conduct of a monk, thus he is a monk;

original: bhinnapaṭadharoti bhikkhu,🔽samaññāya bhikkhu,
analyzed: bhinna paṭa dharo ti bhikkhu  samaññāya bhikkhu
translated: he wears a patched robe, thus he is a monk;🔽he is called a monk;

original: paṭiññāya bhikkhu,
analyzed: paṭiññāya bhikkhu
translated: he is known as a monk;

original: ehi bhikkhūti bhikkhu,
analyzed: ehi bhikkhu iti bhikkhu
translated: he is a monk because he was told “come, monk”;

original: tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampannoti bhikkhu,🔽bhadro bhikkhu,🔽sāro bhikkhu,
analyzed: tīhi saraṇa gamanehi upasampannaḥ ti bhikkhu  bhadraḥ bhikkhu  sāraḥ bhikkhu
translated: he is a monk because he has been fully admitted by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand;🔽he is a good monk;🔽he is a solid monk;

original: sekho bhikkhu,
analyzed: sekhaḥ bhikkhu
translated: he is a monk in training;

original: asekho bhikkhu,
analyzed: asekhaḥ bhikkhu
translated: he is a monk beyond training;

original: samaggena saṅghena ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampannoti bhikkhu.
analyzed: samaggena saṅghena ñatti catutthena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena upasampanno ti bhikkhu
translated: he is a monk because he has been fully admitted by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand and that was done by a unanimous Sangha.

original: Tatra yvāyaṁ bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampanno, ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippeto bhikkhūti.
analyzed: tatra yvā ayam bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ñatti catutthena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena upasampannaḥ ayam imasmin atthe adhippetaḥ bhikkhu iti
translated: “A monk who has been given Acceptance by a unanimous Saṅgha, in accordance with the Dhamma, by means of a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand, in regard to whom the thought ‘He is a monk’ is applicable: it is a monk in regard to whom the thought ‘He is a monk’ is applicable.

original: Sikkhāti
analyzed: sikkhāti
translated: ‘Training’:

original: tisso sikkhā—adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.
analyzed: tissaḥ sikkhā adhi sīla sikkhā adhi citta sikkhā adhi paññā sikkhā
translated: there are three trainings: the training in the higher virtue, the training in the higher mind, and the training in the higher wisdom.

original: Tatra yāyaṁ adhisīlasikkhā, ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippetā sikkhāti.
analyzed: tatra yā ayam adhi sīla sikkhā ayam imasmin atthe adhippetā sikkhāti
translated: The training in the higher virtue is the training in regard to which the thought ‘training’ is applicable.

original: Sājīvaṁ nāma
analyzed: sājīvam nāma
translated: ‘Common practice’:

original: yaṁ bhagavatā paññattaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ, etaṁ sājīvaṁ nāma.
analyzed: yam bhagavatā paññattam sikkhāpade etam sājīvam nāma
translated: the training rules laid down by the Blessed One are called ‘common practice.’

original: Tasmiṁ sikkhati, tena vuccati sājīvasamāpannoti.
analyzed: tasmin sikkhati tena vuccati sa ājīva samāpannaḥ ti
translated: One who trains in that is said to ‘have entered into the common practice.’

original: Sikkhaṁ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṁ anāvikatvāti🔽atthi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā;
analyzed: sikkham a paccakkhāya dubbalyam anāvika tvā iti  atthi bhikkhave dubbalya avikammam ca iva hoti sikkhā ca a paccakkhātā
translated: ‘Without having renounced the training, without having declared his weakness’:🔽There is the case where there is the non-disavowal of the training and the non-declaration of weakness.

original: atthi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.
analyzed: atthi bhikkhave dubbalya avikammam ca iva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā
translated: There is the case where there is the non-disavowal of the training and the declaration of weakness.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
analyzed: kathan ca bhikkhave dubbalya avikammam ca iva hoti sikkhā ca a paccakkhātā
translated: “And how is there the non-disavowal of the training and the non-declaration of weakness?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu ukkaṇṭhitaḥ an abhirataḥ sāmaññā cavitu kāmo
translated: It may be that a monk is discontented, unhappy, and dissatisfied with the spiritual life.

original: bhikkhubhāvaṁ aṭṭīyamāno harāyamāno jigucchamāno
analyzed: bhikkhu bhāvam aṭṭīyamānaḥ harāyamānaḥ jigucchamānaḥ
translated: He is fed up with the monkhood. He is ashamed of it. He is disgusted with it.

original: gihibhāvaṁ patthayamāno🔽upāsakabhāvaṁ patthayamāno🔽ārāmikabhāvaṁ patthayamāno
analyzed: gihi bhāvam patthayamānaḥ  upāsaka bhāvam patthayamānaḥ  ārāmika bhāvam patthayamānaḥ
translated: He wants to be a householder.🔽He wants to be a lay follower.🔽He wants to be a monastery worker.

original: sāmaṇerabhāvaṁ patthayamāno🔽titthiyabhāvaṁ patthayamāno🔽titthiyasāvakabhāvaṁ patthayamāno
analyzed: sāmaṇeḥ abhāvam patthayamānaḥ  titthiya bhāvam patthayamānaḥ  titthiya sāvaka bhāvam patthayamāno
translated: He wants to be a novice monk.🔽He wants to be a monastic of another religion.

original: assamaṇabhāvaṁ patthayamāno🔽asakyaputtiyabhāvaṁ patthayamāno—
analyzed: assamaṇa bhāvam patthayamānaḥ  a sakya puttiya bhāvam patthayamānaḥ
translated: He wants to be a lay follower of another religion.🔽He wants to be someone who is not a monastic.🔽He wants to be someone who is not a follower of the Sakyan.

original: “yannūnāhaṁ buddhaṁ paccakkheyyan”ti vadati viññāpeti.🔽Evampi, bhikkhave, dubbalyāvikammañceva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā.
analyzed: yat nūna aham buddham paccakkheyyanti vadati viññāpeti  evam pi bhikkhave dubbalya avikammam ca iva hoti sikkhā ca a paccakkhātā
translated: He says, ‘I reject the Buddha.’🔽In this way, he is weak in his persistence, but he has not rejected the training.

original: Atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhito anabhirato sāmaññā cavitukāmo🔽bhikkhubhāvaṁ aṭṭīyamāno harāyamāno jigucchamāno
analyzed: atha vā pana ukkaṇṭhitaḥ an abhirataḥ sāmaññā cavitu kāmo  bhikkhu bhāvam aṭṭīyamānaḥ harāyamānaḥ jigucchamānaḥ
translated: It may be that a monk is discontented, unhappy, and dissatisfied with the spiritual life.🔽He is fed up with the monkhood. He is ashamed of it. He is disgusted with it.

original: gihibhāvaṁ patthayamāno …pe…🔽asakyaputtiyabhāvaṁ patthayamāno—
analyzed: gihi bhāvam patthayamāno pe  a sakya puttiya bhāvam patthayamānaḥ
translated: He wants to be a householder. …🔽He wants to be someone who is not a follower of the Sakyan.🔽He says, ‘I reject the Teaching.’ …

original: “yannūnāhaṁ dhammaṁ paccakkheyyan”ti vadati viññāpeti …pe…
analyzed: yat nūna aham dhammam paccakkheyyanti vadati viññāpeti pe
translated: ‘What if I were to reject the Teaching?’ …

original: “yannūnāhaṁ saṅghaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ sikkhaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ vinayaṁ …
analyzed: yat nūna aham saṅgham  yat nūna aham sikkham  yat nūna aham vinayam
translated: ‘What if I were to disrobe?’ …🔽‘What if I were to give up the training?’ …

original: yannūnāhaṁ pātimokkhaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ uddesaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ upajjhāyaṁ …
analyzed: yat nūna aham  uddesam  yat nūna aham
translated: ‘What if I were to give up the Monastic Law?’ …🔽‘What if I were to give up the Pāṭimokkha?’ …🔽‘What if I were to give up the recitation?’ …🔽‘What if I were to abandon my preceptor?’ …

original: yannūnāhaṁ ācariyaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ saddhivihārikaṁ …
analyzed: yat nūna aham  yat nūna aham saddhivihārikam
translated: ‘What if I were to abandon my teacher?’ …🔽‘What if I were to abandon my student?’ …

original: yannūnāhaṁ antevāsikaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ samānupajjhāyakaṁ …
analyzed: yat nūna aham antevāsikam  yat nūna aham samāna upajjhāyakam
translated: ‘What if I were to abandon my pupil?’ …🔽‘What if I were to abandon my fellow student of the same preceptor?’ …

original: yannūnāhaṁ samānācariyakaṁ …🔽yannūnāhaṁ sabrahmacāriṁ paccakkheyyan”ti vadati viññāpeti.🔽“Yannūnāhaṁ gihī assan”ti vadati viññāpeti.🔽“Yannūnāhaṁ upāsako assan”ti …🔽“yannūnāhaṁ ārāmiko assan”ti …

translated: ‘What if I were to abandon my fellow pupil of the same teacher?’ …🔽‘What if I were to abandon my fellow monastic?’🔽‘What if I were to become a householder?’ …🔽‘What if I were to become a lay follower?’ …

original: “yannūnāhaṁ sāmaṇero assan”ti …🔽“yannūnāhaṁ titthiyo assan”ti …

original: “yannūnāhaṁ titthiyasāvako assan”ti …🔽“yannūnāhaṁ assamaṇo assan”ti …
